subject: [OVN] OVN DB schema update aware maintenance tasks
messages: [{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2020-03-19 09:59:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2020-05-05 20:59:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2020-05-07 08:54:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-19 09:59:25.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] OVN DB schema update aware maintenance tasks

This patch introduces a new mechanism to allow rerunning maintenance
tasks upon an OVN database schema change to avoid a service restart.

As an example, the "migrate_to_port_groups" maintenance task will run
again when the database schema is updated. In case of a migration from
an OVN version without port groups support to a version that supports
it, the OVN driver will migrate the code automatically without the need
of a service restart.

(cherry-picked from neutron I520a3de105b4c6924908e099a3b8d60c3280f499)

Change-Id: I27de64b08e7b98b82b9543ef69589170c95b5589
Closes-Bug: #1864641
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] OVN DB schema update aware maintenance tasks

This patch introduces a new mechanism to allow rerunning maintenance
tasks upon an OVN database schema change to avoid a service restart.

As an example, the "migrate_to_port_groups" maintenance task will run
again when the database schema is updated. In case of a migration from
an OVN version without port groups support to a version that supports
it, the OVN driver will migrate the code automatically without the need
of a service restart.

(cherry-picked from neutron I520a3de105b4c6924908e099a3b8d60c3280f499)

Change-Id: I27de64b08e7b98b82b9543ef69589170c95b5589
Closes-Bug: #1864641
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Block influxdb==5.3.0

influxdb release 5.3.0 includes an open bug that breaks many of the
calls to influxdb. Like for example 'SHOW DIAGNOSTICS' [1]

[1] https://github.com/influxdata/influxdb-python/issues/820

Change-Id: Ie802f865ceacbecd5887817fd0f25137d28f5350

commit_message:
Allow multiple methods of installing certbot

Currently the only method is by downloading the certbot-auto script
and executing that. Some distros supply a so this patch sets up
an option for a future patch to add distro package support

Change-Id: Ie32e6f577c9aa898906ee76199fd0ebe75d5ae95

messages: [{'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-04-23 18:34:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-04-23 18:35:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-05-05 21:45:30.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Workflow-1 by Jonathan Rosser <jonathan.rosser@rd.bbc.co.uk>\n'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-05-06 18:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 29865, 'date': '2020-05-07 11:33:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-23 18:34:05.000000000', 'message': 'Add extra controls for frontend redirects

This patch adds two new variables for a service:

* haproxy_redirect_scheme

This variable allows a custom string to be specified to override
the default condition used to redirect http to https.

* haproxy_frontend_acls

This variable works in the same way as haproxy_acls except it applies
the acl to the frontend rather than the backend configuration. This
can be required when some paths are not redirected to https but must
instead be handled by a specific backend.

Change-Id: I6b13375ba738d7659681ca773297d0b6b0fd7efb
'}]
commit_message:
Add extra controls for frontend redirects

This patch adds two new variables for a service:

* haproxy_redirect_scheme

This variable allows a custom string to be specified to override
the default condition used to redirect http to https.

* haproxy_frontend_acls

This variable works in the same way as haproxy_acls except it applies
the acl to the frontend rather than the backend configuration. This
can be required when some paths are not redirected to https but must
instead be handled by a specific backend.

Change-Id: I6b13375ba738d7659681ca773297d0b6b0fd7efb

Change-Id: I42f9e1f68c3a3533a3377f37063f4924cdf77bd6

commit_message:
Allow extra parameters to be passed to certbot

When setting up certbot for the first time, many extra parameters
are available. This new variable allows these to be passed. A typical
example is passing --staging in order to use the letsencrypt staging
endpoint rather than the production one.

Change-Id: I42f9e1f68c3a3533a3377f37063f4924cdf77bd6

commit_message:
Remove testscenarios, testrepository and Babel from test-requirements

Neither of these are really used. They have likely been cargo-culted.

Also removing mock from doc/requirements, not sure how it got there.

Change-Id: I8d242d86af4c6ded215e0bc4cf61da346f21e46c

(grenade-py3 -> grenade).

and stable/ussuri anymore.

commit_message:
Switch to new grenade job name

The integrated gate templates has switched to the new grenade name
(grenade-py3 -> grenade).

Rename the job here as well so that grenade-py3 is not used on master
and stable/ussuri anymore.

Details:
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014602.html

Change-Id: I05a312fb3f2cb44baeecd4b0609f71a21b1c536d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-22 15:44:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix facts gathering for "from files" scenario

delegate_facts should be used as futher we're asking these facts from
localhost, while they will be assigned to original host.
Also _keys are supposed to be dict, but defined as list and `client`
is expected instead of `item`

Change-Id: I719016f454427fcc751d872408c44d665278a0d0
Closes-Bug: 1860572
'}]
commit_message:
Fix facts gathering for "from files" scenario

delegate_facts should be used as futher we're asking these facts from
localhost, while they will be assigned to original host.
Also _keys are supposed to be dict, but defined as list and `client`
is expected instead of `item`

Change-Id: I719016f454427fcc751d872408c44d665278a0d0
Closes-Bug: 1860572

commit_message:
Remove the release note job

The networking-ovn has no master anymore, it has been removed at
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715174/ because the code has now moved
to another repository (openstack/neutron).

Due to this, the release note job will fail and should be removed as
stated in a comment by Andreas at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/704898/

Change-Id: I13c055a8d971dd059ba2ace6f35bcc708b7654af
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

nova: Add configurable to control use of RBD block devices

This change introduces NOVA_CEPH_BLOCK_DEVICE to allow the
[workarounds]/rbd_block_device configurable to be enabled.

[{'created': '2020-05-05 22:44:00.000000000', 'message': 'Conditionally restore default route in setup_ipv6

Restoring the default IPv6 route is not needed in CI and
fails when there are multiple defaults, but it is useful
in local devstacks where multiple default routes are not
typical.

Add a variable in settings and use it to make this behavior
conditional and set it to False for the lvm job.

Closes-bug: #1836788
Change-Id: Id73de8100509ec5935641f5f35f93f482d108bcd
(cherry picked from commit 70e908344dd4db81652264a2de2c04ce9666bb46)
(cherry picked from commit 99c0a110920910bfd379d544e7085daca90b1132)
'}]
commit_message:
Conditionally restore default route in setup_ipv6

Restoring the default IPv6 route is not needed in CI and
fails when there are multiple defaults, but it is useful
in local devstacks where multiple default routes are not
typical.

Add a variable in settings and use it to make this behavior
conditional and set it to False for the lvm job.

Closes-bug: #1836788
Change-Id: Id73de8100509ec5935641f5f35f93f482d108bcd
(cherry picked from commit 70e908344dd4db81652264a2de2c04ce9666bb46)
(cherry picked from commit 99c0a110920910bfd379d544e7085daca90b1132)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I00b5b48e0fe41ac4c7a09a3a4e07cfb69dd48f85

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I5f928e9ff06c0b19e429cb5d269a107abcd326f6

- [1] can be permanent in the code because we don't use the dnsmsaq hostfile stored hostnames. That means this ipv4/6 join made in [1] is backwards compatible.

 > hostfile stored hostnames. That means this ipv4/6 join made in [1]
 > is backwards compatible.
 >

 > 
 > [1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/725246/

I think [1] can be improved, since it will create a single host record for each port we should no longer need these two methods _merge_alloc_addr6_list() and _sort_fixed_ips_for_dnsmasq(). A bit of optimization is never bad.


What's speaking for this change is that we need a backport, this is less complex, and thus lower risk of introducing another issue.


I don't have a strong opinion, this was proposed to have an alternative to [1] or a fix in dnsmasq itself."}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2020-05-06 09:11:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

[{'created': '2020-05-04 18:56:25.000000000', 'message': "Use dhcp-host tag support when supported

In dnsmasq 2.81 there is a regression (see [1] for details)
which causes problem that when dnsmasq will find first entry
for MAC address it will stop processing the file.

The same issue is also backported to the dnsmasq-2.79-11.el8.x86_64
which is e.g. in RHEL 8.2 and probably will be in Centos 8.

dnsmasq version 2.81 also adds support for using tag's on host
entries. When a dhcpv6 request is recived, dnsmasq automatically
sets the tag 'dhcpv6'.

This change add's a runtime check, testing for dnsmasq host entry
tag support. And adds 'tag:dhcpv6' to all IPv6 host entries when
dnsmasq supports this.

Adding the tag makes dnsmasq prefer the tagged host for dhcpv6
requests, i.e it's a workaround fix for the regression issue.

[1] http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2020q2/014038.html

Closes-Bug: #1876094
Change-Id: Ie654c84137914226bdc3e31e16219345c2efaac9

This change add's a runtime check, testing for dnsmasq host entry

dnsmasq supports this.

Adding the tag makes dnsmasq prefer the tagged host for dhcpv6

[1] http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2020q2/014038.html

"}, {'created': '2020-05-06 23:35:37.000000000', 'message': "Use dhcp-host tag support when supported

In dnsmasq 2.81 there is a regression (see [1] for details).
Prior versions of dnsmasq would select a host record where:
a) no address is present in the host record.
b) an address matching address family of the client request
   is present in the host record.

dnsmasq 2.81 will also use a host record where a address not
matching the address family of the client request is present.

The same issue is also backported to the dnsmasq-2.79-11.el8.x86_64
which is e.g. in RHEL 8.2 and Centos 8.

dnsmasq version 2.81 also adds support for using tag's on host
records. When a dhcpv6 request is received, dnsmasq automatically
sets the tag 'dhcpv6'.

This change adds a runtime check, testing for dnsmasq host entry
tag support. And adds 'tag:dhcpv6' to all IPv6 host records when
dnsmasq supports this.

Adding the tag makes dnsmasq prefer the tagged host for dhcpv6
requests, i.e it's a workaround fix for the regression issue.

[1] http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2020q2/014051.html

Closes-Bug: #1876094
Change-Id: Ie654c84137914226bdc3e31e16219345c2efaac9
"}, {'created': '2020-05-06 23:38:48.000000000', 'message': "Use dhcp-host tag support when supported

In dnsmasq 2.81 there is a regression (see [1] for details).
Prior versions of dnsmasq would select a host record where:
a) no address is present in the host record.
b) an address matching address family of the client request
   is present in the host record.

dnsmasq 2.81 will also use a host record where a only an address
not matching the address family of the client request is present.

The same issue is also backported to the dnsmasq-2.79-11.el8.x86_64
which is e.g. in RHEL 8.2 and Centos 8.

dnsmasq version 2.81 also adds support for using tag's on host
records. When a dhcpv6 request is received, dnsmasq automatically
sets the tag 'dhcpv6'.

This change adds a runtime check, testing for dnsmasq host entry
tag support. And adds 'tag:dhcpv6' to all IPv6 host records when
dnsmasq supports this.

Adding the tag makes dnsmasq prefer the tagged host for dhcpv6
requests, i.e it's a workaround fix for the regression issue.

[1] http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2020q2/014051.html

Closes-Bug: #1876094
Change-Id: Ie654c84137914226bdc3e31e16219345c2efaac9
"}]
commit_message:
Use dhcp-host tag support when supported

In dnsmasq 2.81 there is a regression (see [1] for details).
Prior versions of dnsmasq would select a host record where:
a) no address is present in the host record.
b) an address matching address family of the client request
   is present in the host record.

dnsmasq 2.81 will also use a host record where a only an address
not matching the address family of the client request is present.

The same issue is also backported to the dnsmasq-2.79-11.el8.x86_64
which is e.g. in RHEL 8.2 and Centos 8.

dnsmasq version 2.81 also adds support for using tag's on host
records. When a dhcpv6 request is received, dnsmasq automatically
sets the tag 'dhcpv6'.

This change adds a runtime check, testing for dnsmasq host entry
tag support. And adds 'tag:dhcpv6' to all IPv6 host records when
dnsmasq supports this.

Adding the tag makes dnsmasq prefer the tagged host for dhcpv6
requests, i.e it's a workaround fix for the regression issue.

[1] http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2020q2/014051.html

Closes-Bug: #1876094
Change-Id: Ie654c84137914226bdc3e31e16219345c2efaac9

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-29 21:01:29.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Use local py2 upper-constraints

The global upper constraints repo will no longer track py2 packages,
meaning upper constraints for the py2.7 runtime will need to be handled
locally.

This adds an in-repo file for upper constraints enforcement using the
last py27 constraints from openstack/requirements to validate
functionality.

Note: another option would be to configure these environments to point
at the stable/ussuri upper constraints, but that has the drawback that
if a package does actually release a new py27 compatible version, it
will not be as easy to pick that up. With keeping the constraints
locally, the team has full control to change those constraints as
needed.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/720264/

Change-Id: I624f914c6155178cbe474f1eae2871e2aef721eb
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-04-29 21:10:35.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Use local py2 upper-constraints

The global upper constraints repo will no longer track py2 packages,
meaning upper constraints for the py2.7 runtime will need to be handled
locally.

This adds an in-repo file for upper constraints enforcement using the
last py27 constraints from openstack/requirements to validate
functionality.

Note: another option would be to configure these environments to point
at the stable/ussuri upper constraints, but that has the drawback that
if a package does actually release a new py27 compatible version, it
will not be as easy to pick that up. With keeping the constraints
locally, the team has full control to change those constraints as
needed.

Change-Id: I624f914c6155178cbe474f1eae2871e2aef721eb
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-05-04 12:04:09.000000000', 'message': 'Use local py2 upper-constraints

commit_message:
Use local py2 upper-constraints

The global upper constraints repo will no longer track py2 packages,
meaning upper constraints for the py2.7 runtime will need to be handled
locally.

This adds an in-repo file for upper constraints enforcement using the
last py27 constraints from openstack/requirements to validate
functionality.

Change-Id: I624f914c6155178cbe474f1eae2871e2aef721eb
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1736, 'name': 'Ivan Kolodyazhny', 'email': 'e0ne@e0ne.info', 'username': 'e0ne'}, {'_account_id': 4523, 'name': 'Eric Harney', 'email': 'eharney@redhat.com', 'username': 'eharney'}, {'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 7198, 'name': 'Jay Bryant', 'email': 'jungleboyj@electronicjungle.net', 'username': 'jsbryant'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26458, 'name': 'Brin Zhang', 'email': 'zhangbailin@inspur.com', 'username': 'zhangbailin'}, {'_account_id': 27615, 'name': 'Rajat Dhasmana', 'email': 'rajatdhasmana@gmail.com', 'username': 'whoami-rajat'}, {'_account_id': 30407, 'name': 'haixin', 'email': 'haix09@chinatelecom.cn', 'username': 'haixin'}]

[{'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2019-10-22 06:34:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2019-10-22 06:35:01.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bp/volume-record-failure-info'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-10-22 07:17:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2019-10-22 08:22:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2019-10-22 08:22:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(6 comments)

thank for your review,Brin Zhang.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-10-22 10:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

haixin, you should add more details for this SPEC.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-22 11:24:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

How does this differ from user messages? I think it needs more detail and a better explanation of how this will be used differently than that functionality.'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2019-10-23 09:13:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2019-10-23 10:00:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)

thank for your review,Sean McGinnis,Brin Zhang.
I think this feature and user messages have the following differences.
(1):user messages can not be queried using volume ID, only by message id, If there were a lot of results returned, it would take us a long time to find the error message in the result that we want to see for that volume ID, but this feature will support query by volume ID.
(2)There may be multiple asynchronous errors in the same volume,user messages will force the user to find the most recent asynchronous error at the time of creation, this feature will return the last asynchronous error message.
(3)There are 12 actions and 16 details defined in user messages, If a new feature comes along later, We will have to manually extend Their definition, It's inconvenient. in this feature error messages are automatically captured using function decorators.
(4)this feature can also captured traceback information(details column in database),This will make it easier for users or developers to locate the error directly."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-10-23 17:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1):user messages can not be queried using volume ID, only by message id
This is not accurate.  User messages can be queried by volume IDs.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-10-23 17:07:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

This looks like it should reuse the user messages framework, with the additional functionality of auto-capturing more failures in the code rather than relying so much on hard-coded messages for particular cases.'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2019-10-24 02:17:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

thank for your review,Eric Harney.
I've tried again, user messages can can be queried by volume IDs.
Yes, the framework of this feature is similar to user messages, but it is more extensible than user messages by using decorators to automatically catch asynchronous error messages, rather than relying so much on hard-coded messages for particular cases, I think it's useful to us."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-12-09 21:58:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I agree with Eric and Sean, it would be better to work this into the user message framework.  Your point that the user messages show you multiple faults, not just the most recent, seems more of a feature than a bug to me.

Additionally, each of these faults probably *should* be represented by a user message (even if we add a 'fault' element to the get-volume response).

Finally, I think the 'detail' field needs to be observable by an admin only, because it could leak administrative information about the cloud that shouldn't be exposed to users."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2019-12-18 20:48:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

Several issues to address if we go forward with this.  Also sounds like this may not be the right way to implement it.'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2019-12-20 07:07:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2019-12-20 07:47:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(6 comments)

thank for your review, Brian Rosmaita and Jay Bryant.
   In order to avoid leak administrative information to the end user.
I've optimized this feature, only admin can get attr of fault.
   This framework is different from user messages, it can auto-capturing
more failures in the code rather than relying so much on hard-coded
messages for particular cases(as Eric Harney said), Ability to pinpoint
a line in a file.it will help developers or operations staff to locate
code errors."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-01-28 16:20:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

I'm still not quite sold on this.  A few typos and points I'd like you to address are noted inline.

It looks like the use case being addressed now is: A customer has a volume in error status and contacts the operator; the operator wants to be able to do a volume-show and see the 'fault' information for the most recent error event that this particular volume had.

I guess this new table won't get out of hand if we only store the most recent fault for any volume.  But I'm not sure that using something like Logstash might be more useful."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-01-28 16:26:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I don't want to give the impression that I'm against this, either.  One good outcome would be that after you've implemented this change, it should be easy for someone to follow up and make sure that we're recording a user message corresponding to each of these faults, which would be nice for end users."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2020-01-28 21:00:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-01-29 13:15:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

Eric raises a good point, that it's not obvious why the current user message framework cannot handle your use case.  See our comments inline, and please address them on your next revision.  Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-02-02 20:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2

The spec freeze for Ussuri has passed.  If you are still interested in this proposal, please revise and retarget the spec for the Victoria release.'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2020-02-04 02:43:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(7 comments)

thank you Eric Harney and Brian Rosmaita.
It might be a good idea to optimize the user message framework, so both message and detail are filled in automatically instead of in message_field
Fixed, message populates the captured exception message, and details populates the error stack to help the user quickly retrieve the corresponding error log.'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2020-05-07 09:36:25.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add features for volume to record failure info

This feature will support to record volume error info to the database
automatically when volume meet some action error, it will help us to
find the failure reasonably quickly, and save the trouble of finding the
corresponding error log in the multi-node cluster.

Change-Id: I962c998ac62f4468a1deebd5757b0e0b628d9a26

commit_message:
Display more help to the new-release wrapper

If we miss something with this command we need to get the
python script's help to get how to use this tools, these changes
add the command to execute through the wrapper to get this help.

Change-Id: I1e9fceece6fee40722e21e49ca5689faacefdf93

commit_message:
Add stable ussuri job on master gate

stable/ussuri branch is setup now
- https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:qa-ussuri-release+status:merged+projects:openstack/devstack

and Tempest and plugins master version is used to test the stable/ussuri.

Adding a stable job for ussuri on master so that any new tests
or changes does not break the stable ussuri testing.

Tempest already added the stable/ussuri job on master gate so adding it
for plugins is safe now.
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/723620/

Change-Id: If8afdbd9b933bf1b07bef1dec54f54a46917d9fd

commit_message:
Monkey patch original current_thread _active

Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active
global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592

Change-Id: I4a3b59b1059c3ab8e515d771a0411baafbbd28c4
Closes-Bug: #1863021

Change-Id: I8e8a9ce5085b7915994317af5ea903cf8a39e809

commit_message:
Monkey patch original current_thread _active

Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active
global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592

Change-Id: I8e8a9ce5085b7915994317af5ea903cf8a39e809
Closes-Bug: #1863021
(cherry picked from commit 44e77ea9a975e9222f38591151e2c32640ef7379)

commit_message:
Update doc: Using version 3 to update not_operator_support.rst

Now part of the document is version 2 syntax, and part of it is version 3.
So the document needs to be updated to Syntax 3 to replace Syntax 2.

Implements: blueprint doc-upgrade
Change-Id: Ic0d312922e4e5e34038ab4fc8d22999d679626eb

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: Idac937dd704ef11dfc33e197f7539e3f7a5feb92

commit_message:
Remove Babel requirement

Babel is not needed as requirement, remove it.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014227.html

Change-Id: I3cec266e4326b4f0749d70f6733023c73ca08d80

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6469, 'name': 'Carlos GonÃ§alves', 'display_name': 'Carlos Goncalves', 'email': 'cgoncalves@redhat.com', 'username': 'cgoncalves'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios@redhat.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 29755, 'name': 'wesgerrit hayutin', 'email': 'wesgerrithayutin@gmail.com'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2020-02-04 11:43:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-02-04 11:48:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This will fail if the job is scheduled to a non-nested virtualization nodepool provider (e.g. RAX).'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-02-04 11:49:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It would be better having a detection mechanism like devstack has [1] where it checks if KVM is available. If it is, use it, otherwise fallback to QEMU.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/master/lib/nova#L253-L267'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-02-04 15:04:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

scenario 10 didn't fail because it was scheduled for a nodepool provider with nested virt enabled (OVH, host centos-7-ovh-gra1-0014319642).

At least we can confirm that the params are being applied:

* -machine pc-i440fx-rhel7.6.0,accel=kvm,usb=off,dump-guest-core=off

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/227c373f3c1a4d90906d1d408c818dd2/log/logs/undercloud/var/log/libvirt/qemu/instance-00000001.log#10

* cpu_mode=host-passthrough

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/227c373f3c1a4d90906d1d408c818dd2/log/logs/undercloud/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/nova_libvirt/etc/nova/nova.conf#3596

* virt_type=kvm

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/227c373f3c1a4d90906d1d408c818dd2/log/logs/undercloud/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/nova_libvirt/etc/nova/nova.conf#3437"}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2020-05-07 06:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Not working on it currently, so abandoning it'}]

messages:
[{'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-04-25 11:21:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-04-25 12:40:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-04-26 14:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This breaks Ubuntu (or atleast breakes it more) this is not packaged in Ubuntu so need to add Debian specific checks and not just OS family'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-04-29 14:37:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Thanks for your catch, Tobias.
Yeah seems like does not have all of these packages, while it has some packages with the different names like https://packages.ubuntu.com/eoan/python3-neutron-tempest-plugin .

So seems like we need to check operatingsystem to distinguish Ubuntu.'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-04-30 23:05:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi,

FYI, in Ubuntu, it's python3-neutron-tempest-plugin because they just imported the old package I wrote, and they aren't up-to-date yet.

I'll do what you ask and make it Debian specific though. :)"}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-05-04 07:58:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-05-05 15:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-05-06 22:29:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-05-07 05:25:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Fix Debian package names

The names in params.pp were not defined, and Debian did release
new packages for tempest plugins recently.

Change-Id: I42d9ccf69b927954f6b45f6eb36a985f65a301df

[{'created': '2020-05-06 08:44:17.000000000', 'message': 'Monkey patch original current_thread _active

Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active
global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592

Also disable E402 to allow the change in.

Change-Id: I508fcd0707ecdd2bf720303f6cbb4087a38aaadd
Closes-Bug: #1863021
(cherry picked from commit fe543a67c70e212967bda0e3e45dc9363eaf8fcf)
'}]
commit_message:
Monkey patch original current_thread _active

Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active
global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592

Also disable E402 to allow the change in.

Change-Id: I508fcd0707ecdd2bf720303f6cbb4087a38aaadd
Closes-Bug: #1863021
(cherry picked from commit fe543a67c70e212967bda0e3e45dc9363eaf8fcf)

commit_message:
Handle resources without a name

This commit prevents silent failures when encountering a resource with no name,
which has been observed with glance images that are in a "queued" state.

Change-Id: I65aec02c4e5ac66811006ec7f6ab0c17056ffdb7
Closes-Bug: #1746539
(cherry picked from commit ed1a2581825effe63277f5620f2b126c1ff7c999)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-06 15:15:47.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure OAuth1 authorized roles are respected

Without this patch, when an OAuth1 request token is authorized with a
limited set of roles, the roles for the access token are ignored when
the user uses it to request a keystone token. This means that user of an
access token can use it to escallate their role assignments beyond what
was authorized by the creator. This patch fixes the issue by ensuring
the token model accounts for an OAuth1-scoped token and correctly
populating the roles for it.

Change-Id: I02f9836fbd4d7e629653977fc341476cfd89859e
Closes-bug: #1873290
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure OAuth1 authorized roles are respected

Without this patch, when an OAuth1 request token is authorized with a
limited set of roles, the roles for the access token are ignored when
the user uses it to request a keystone token. This means that user of an
access token can use it to escallate their role assignments beyond what
was authorized by the creator. This patch fixes the issue by ensuring
the token model accounts for an OAuth1-scoped token and correctly
populating the roles for it.

Change-Id: I02f9836fbd4d7e629653977fc341476cfd89859e
Closes-bug: #1873290

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Allowing for legacy multi-attach

Allow for a case where one or more attached volume is in the
legacy format and one or more is in the new template format
for short host name

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-05-06 19:26:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-05-06 20:19:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

this is useless. The error that is happening with CI is the fact memcached container fails to be stopped and removed. This can happen in the standalone upgrade job as well if memcached is installed. 

IMO we shouldn't add more jobs like this into tripleo-ansible."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-05-06 20:22:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-05-06 20:23:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

this isn't the way to improve coverage.
I'm analyzing the logs at this time and the issue is for some reasons the memcached container isn't stopped and removed correctly (some podman weirdness again).

My point is that before adding more jobs because the undercloud-upgrade is green in Zuul, we should do proper RCA, find the issue and identify is whether or not we need more CI.

Apparently this wasn't done yet."}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-05-06 20:32:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-05-06 23:29:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-05-07 03:34:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

standalone-upgrade-train is branched properly
for stein->train

commit_message:
tripleo_container_*/molecule: pull fedora instead of centos8

In these tests, we use the fedora container and not centos:8; so right
after when we run "podman run", it can fail if the fedora image isn't
pulled.

Let's pull the right image before the podman run.

Change-Id: If32d5f9e3ff1a590d2fc467969404861ec733f9b

[{'created': '2020-05-06 11:32:40.000000000', 'message': 'Use registry_namespace for pulling out successful containers

Currently tripleo {{ ci_branch }} var is used for pulling
successful containers but for centos-8 train, namespace is
different and there we are not able to list the successful
containers as containers are there with different namespace.
Using registry_namespace fixes the issue.

Change-Id: If13efe67c87d0925fdb2a371e15c587c5c42a164
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Use registry_namespace for pulling out successful containers

Currently tripleo {{ ci_branch }} var is used for pulling
successful containers but for centos-8 train, namespace is
different and there we are not able to list the successful
containers as containers are there with different namespace.
Using registry_namespace fixes the issue.

Change-Id: If13efe67c87d0925fdb2a371e15c587c5c42a164
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
create CentOS-8 train release config

use a unique container registry namespace
to enable the coexistence of centos7 and
centos8 train jobs.

Reference to unique registry namespace
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/26280/

Co-authored-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I43717e5e8fa75a4668bb9052027e3c5e4103b29a

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

commit_message:
Fix create custom Mistral action

Class mistral.actions.base.Action is moved to
mistral_lib.actions.Action accoring to
https://docs.openstack.org/mistral/latest/developer/extensions/creating_custom_action.html

This change imports the new action class and
add context parameter for the run method.

Related-Bug: #1874007
Change-Id: I7858f69ca051c64a8ac52e6bfde353d55a42a43e

commit_message:
Remove Babel requirement

Babel is not needed as requirement, remove it.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014227.html

Change-Id: Id5c54668738e3de8ded900f389b646dcdef5d007

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-05 05:26:06.000000000', 'message': "[devstack][ci] Set public network ID in tempest.conf

When running IPv6 tests, we disable the creation of
the public network in devstack, and handle it in the
devstack plugin. So, we'll need to configure it
in tempest in the plugin.

Change-Id: Icf5f26397e16d7fbfae77aa246ac5e35581f441e
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
[devstack][ci] Set public network ID in tempest.conf

When running IPv6 tests, we disable the creation of
the public network in devstack, and handle it in the
devstack plugin. So, we'll need to configure it
in tempest in the plugin.

Change-Id: Icf5f26397e16d7fbfae77aa246ac5e35581f441e
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Deprecating Old Dell SC Volume Config

A new Dell SC volume config which supports both iSCSI and FC drivers
is added. Deprecating the old Dell SC config
See review https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722538/

Change-Id: I3402f71fde956ede80da0840780ad4bd227103c7

commit_message:
Stop and remove container with module

For stopping and removing podman container use podman_container
modules which is idempotent. Retry it a few times if it doesn't
pass first time.

Partial-Bug: #1876893
Change-Id: Ic9f063eac866b25f980f20f86502653289321592

commit_message:
trivial: add spaces after punctuation in config help text

This was rendering without proper spacing in between periods and new
sentences. This commit updates the spacing so the sample
undercloud.conf render with spacing between sentences.

Change-Id: I9b20cf1332eb6e832f637db5ed465b7261105c08

commit_message:
Add tempest-cleanup ansible role

The patch adds a new ansible role called tempest-cleanup which will
allow us to test tempest cleanup in the gate jobs.

Change-Id: I2cef2da6fee13e622da07b890da88850fe420152

commit_message:
Update grenade job

- tempest tests regex: ironic_tempest_plugin.tests.scenario
- added LIBVIRT_STORAGE_PATH
- added BASE_RUN_SMOKE False to avoid running smoke tests
before the upgrade.
- added IRONIC_TEMPEST_BUILD_TIMEOUT

Change-Id: Iebf9a609baac56a796e7b86291be746ba5233bdf

[{'created': '2020-04-14 09:17:28.000000000', 'message': 'ci: Remove unnecessary container build tasks

Since we use upstream hyperkube images for Podman + Fedora CoreOS, we no
longer need to build Kubernetes images ourselves, and the last one we
needed to build was the v1.15.x stream which will not have any more
releases now that v1.18.x is out. This PS proposes removing these tasks.

Story: 2005124
Task: 39398

Change-Id: I458767dc12b46d665777ebe019c46565f37dd959
'}, {'created': '2020-04-14 11:00:48.000000000', 'message': 'ci: Remove unnecessary container build tasks

Since Train release, we use upstream hyperkube image for fedora-atomic
(when use_podman=True label is set) and fedora-coreos drivers. The last
image we needed to build through the CI was for v1.15.x (now EOL since
v1.18.x is out) and v1.16.x+ has never been supported by the
fedora-atomic driver without the use_podman label. This does not affect
older images that have already been published on Docker hub:
https://hub.docker.com/search?q=openstackmagnum%2Fkubernetes&type=image.

This PS proposes removing the Ansible tasks to build these containers.

Story: 2005124

commit_message:
[ci] Remove unnecessary container build tasks

Since Train release, we use upstream hyperkube image for fedora-atomic
(when use_podman=True label is set) and fedora-coreos drivers. The last
image we needed to build through the CI was for v1.15.x (because the
Kubernetes project maintains release branches for the most recent three
minor releases: 1.18, 1.17, 1.16 [0]) and v1.16.x+ has never been
supported by the fedora-atomic driver without the use_podman label.

This PS proposes removing the Ansible tasks to build these containers
through the CI. This does not affect already published older images:
https://hub.docker.com/search?q=openstackmagnum%2Fkubernetes&type=image.

[0] https://kubernetes.io/docs/setup/release/version-skew-policy/#supported-versions

Story: 2005124
Task: 39398

Change-Id: I458767dc12b46d665777ebe019c46565f37dd959

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Update contributor documentation

This patch updates/adds the contributor documentation to follow
the guidelines of the Ussuri cycle community goal[1].

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/project-ptl-and-contrib-docs.html
Story: #2007236
Task: #38554

Change-Id: I1c5e5ae8c734ab051bb889588dfd0fa908ee4ff3

[{'created': '2020-05-04 21:49:04.000000000', 'message': '[ci][devstack] Install bridge-utils for Container driver

Devstack no longer installs this package after [1]. The driver
needs to replace the use of brctl to completely remove this
package from our test environments.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/724443/

Change-Id: Id6094827341bf6ef8856cd4e7af11b36e9afb560

commit_message:
[ci][devstack] Install bridge-utils for Container driver

Devstack no longer installs this package after [1]. The driver
needs to replace the use of brctl to completely remove this
package from our test environments.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/724443/
Partial-Bug: #1876820

Change-Id: Id6094827341bf6ef8856cd4e7af11b36e9afb560
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update roles path tripleo-ansible and tripleo-ipa repos

https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible and
https://opendev.org/x/tripleo-ipa are both
requirements for the ipa-multinode role.
This review updates the role path and adds a comment
to include these repos in a manual standalone
installation.

Related review: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/720757/
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/670
Change-Id: I182de928e1b32e52bbf527313540ad32ada1278d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-06 21:11:35.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo_container_rm: more robust tasks to remove a container

1) Try to gracefully stop a container before removing it, using the
   tripleo_container_stop role already used in TripleO.

2) Add retries when removing the containers in case podman is still
   stopping the container and making it available for deletion in
   storage. This should avoid errors when the systemd is slow and we
   get: "device or resource busy"

3) Improve zuul jobs coverage by running tripleo_container_manage and
   tripleo_container_rm when files in tripleo_podman_container_stop are
   touched; it'll avoid potential regressions in that role.

Related-Bug: #1876893
Change-Id: Idf167cc68c2a8a5909018e6cac346bbee5a84b91
'}, {'created': '2020-05-06 21:16:52.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo_container_rm: more robust tasks to remove a container

2) Add retries when removing the containers in case podman is still
   stopping the container and making it available for deletion in
   storage. This should avoid errors when the systemd is slow and we
   get: "device or resource busy"

3) Allow to perform container stop in best effort with a new parameter:
   tripleo_container_ignore_stop_errors which is False by default but
   set to True when the role is called from tripleo_container_rm; so we

commit_message:
tripleo_container_rm: more robust tasks to remove a container

1) Try to gracefully stop a container before removing it, using the
   tripleo_container_stop role already used in TripleO.

2) Add retries when removing the containers in case podman is still
   stopping the container and making it available for deletion in
   storage. This should avoid errors when the systemd is slow and we
   get: "device or resource busy"

3) Allow to perform container stop in best effort with a new parameter:
   tripleo_container_ignore_stop_errors which is False by default but
   set to True when the role is called from tripleo_container_rm; so we
   tolerate a container which was already stopped or not here.

4) Improve zuul jobs coverage by running tripleo_container_manage and
   tripleo_container_rm when files in tripleo_podman_container_stop are
   touched; it'll avoid potential regressions in that role.

Related-Bug: #1876893
Change-Id: Idf167cc68c2a8a5909018e6cac346bbee5a84b91

global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:

commit_message:
Update to hacking 3.0

Update to newest hacking version, it has only minimal changes and full
support for Python 3.

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
as they are not actually used in tests (other than pep8).

Change-Id: Ia005547d7a8353b629f2262f424d7761c45b185f

commit_message:
Delete type access list when deleting types

Currently we're in a foobar situation with two database
models ShareTypeProjects and ShareGroupTypeProjects
where we keep stuff around even when the concerned
ShareType or ShareGroupType objects are deleted.

So, delete type access rules when types are being deleted.

Change-Id: Id135a96f2d1b7306156bab0ddedcb1b838a74f0a
Closes-Bug: #1870751
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5f80a24ff2a9e68a34e9257a1e533b5dfc8c65da)
(cherry picked from commit da38cf6194fe748edc82bcbc51bd7e8127fb15c4)
(cherry picked from commit 995b8c3150e00ba514d86f67388bdb43637c8a15)

commit_message:
Fix migration ordering issue

The task model rework has some migration ordering issues,
this fixes that and ensures action migrations don't
continue until other steps are done.

Change-Id: I3c3669a12e5d5d6b11fdf0e49b14894468287b6a

commit_message:
Drop pip-and-virtualenv from SUSE 15

We are ready to drop pip-and-virtualenv from SUSE 15.  zuul-jobs is
passing for plain nodes [1] and devstack-based jobs are working
(e.g. keystone jobs tested with [2]).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/724776
[2] https://review.opendev.org/723762

Change-Id: I9fed82a2ba02d5d7882c280645ef7b04a36e0563

commit_message:
Stop and remove container with module

For stopping and removing podman container use podman_container
modules which is idempotent. Retry it a few times if it doesn't
pass first time.

Partial-Bug: #1876893
(cherry picked from commit 14dc45d7cd20c9bc77817284d8f0c7720a92e5de)
Change-Id: Ic9f063eac866b25f980f20f86502653289321592

In Ib93b1ad7ef55d5ee41a6c26e200589950c1858e6 I had called the

Change-Id: I8120cc729eb759f5358ffba87510d04d8c774bea

commit_message:
Replace accidental references to ScaleUp with ScaleOut

In Ib93b1ad7ef55d5ee41a6c26e200589950c1858e6 I had called the
DistributedComputeHCIScaleOut role DistributedComputeHCIScaleUp
by accident in some places. This fixes that.

Change-Id: I8120cc729eb759f5358ffba87510d04d8c774bea

subject: tripleo_container_*/molecule: pull fedora instead of centos8
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-06 20:17:26.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo_container_*/molecule: pull fedora instead of centos8

In these tests, we use the fedora container and not centos:8; so right
after when we run "podman run", it can fail if the fedora image isn't
pulled.

Let's pull the right image before the podman run.

Change-Id: If32d5f9e3ff1a590d2fc467969404861ec733f9b
'}]
commit_message:
tripleo_container_*/molecule: pull fedora instead of centos8

In these tests, we use the fedora container and not centos:8; so right
after when we run "podman run", it can fail if the fedora image isn't
pulled.

Let's pull the right image before the podman run.

Change-Id: If32d5f9e3ff1a590d2fc467969404861ec733f9b

to install py3 isntead.
Additionally patch extends explanation regarding lvm usage for lxc storage

This solves our deployment issue where we don't have access to Ceph hosts at all."}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-04-29 05:59:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-05-06 16:45:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-05-06 21:23:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-28 18:32:14.000000000', 'message': "Do not try to connect to mons when everything is provided

We shouldn't try to access monitors in case deployer has provided both
ceph config and ceph auth.
So that deployers wouldn't have to provide access to their ceph clusters
to the deploy host.

Change-Id: If0b4319826abd8991a81d39ca049e8063a667685
"}]
commit_message:
Do not try to connect to mons when everything is provided

We shouldn't try to access monitors in case deployer has provided both
ceph config and ceph auth.
So that deployers wouldn't have to provide access to their ceph clusters
to the deploy host.

Change-Id: If0b4319826abd8991a81d39ca049e8063a667685

commit_message:
Add defensive code in case port is not passed on relation

The shared-db relation now has a port added, but we can't be certain
that every provider will supply it.  Therefore, check the port is
set to something (i.e. not false-y) and only use it if it is.

Change-Id: Ia7bdba0ae7c1979ed860796f58b22a1e7d5880df

commit_message:
Add py38 package metadata

Now that we are running the Victoria tests that include a
voting py38, we can now add the Python 3.8 metadata to the
package information to reflect that support.

Change-Id: I3c1e65466fa22747e66b25ea09dd518fcc311723
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-04-29 20:57:14.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp ONTAP NFS driver fail to flexclone glance image.

When the driver is trying to perform a flexclone from glance is
making a bad reference to a non-existent methond utils.resolve_hostname
the correct method is volume_utils.resolve_hostname

Change-Id: I5cd729bdd1fb97b07610b1971232c786bad7917d
Closes-Bug: #1875959
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP NFS driver fail to flexclone glance image.

When the driver is trying to perform a flexclone from glance is
making a bad reference to a non-existent methond utils.resolve_hostname
the correct method is volume_utils.resolve_hostname

Change-Id: I5cd729bdd1fb97b07610b1971232c786bad7917d
Closes-Bug: #1875959

commit_message:
Remove fwaas_driver.ini from neutron sanity checks

The fwaas driver isn't generally supported and while included in the
kolla containers, there is no current means to configure it in tripleo.

Change-Id: I6fb4cfa7c9ef0f2589a01e83792cc0422cfebe78
(cherry picked from commit b0021c3e8374a11162c7dbede863b0035a2352eb)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 12:50:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix missing OctaviaClientCert* parameters

OctaviaClientCert and OctaviaClientCertFile parameters
were incorrectly removed in change
Ia64668f9ef6efc91a05594ca34c35614d338fdb6.

That breaks the user-provided certificate & key feature in Octavia
deployments by not copying the client certificate to the controllers,
Octavia services are then unable to communicate with running amphorae.

This commit restores those parameters.

Change-Id: I42b48a10512ef817203705a201c0b30d8d1bd50b
Closes-Bug: #1874712
'}, {'created': '2020-04-24 14:58:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix missing OctaviaClientCert* parameters

OctaviaClientCert and OctaviaClientCertFile parameters
were incorrectly removed in change
Ia64668f9ef6efc91a05594ca34c35614d338fdb6.

That breaks the user-provided certificate & key feature in Octavia
deployments by not copying the client certificate to the controllers,
Octavia services are then unable to communicate with running amphorae.

This commit restores those parameters.

Change-Id: I42b48a10512ef817203705a201c0b30d8d1bd50b
Closes-Bug: #1874712
'}]
commit_message:
Fix missing OctaviaClientCert* parameters

OctaviaClientCert and OctaviaClientCertFile parameters
were incorrectly removed in change
Ia64668f9ef6efc91a05594ca34c35614d338fdb6.

That breaks the user-provided certificate & key feature in Octavia
deployments by not copying the client certificate to the controllers,
Octavia services are then unable to communicate with running amphorae.

This commit restores those parameters.

Change-Id: I42b48a10512ef817203705a201c0b30d8d1bd50b
Closes-Bug: #1874712

tripleoclient needs the validations-libs as dependencie, we need to
add the validations-libs to the global-requirements:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714629/

Answers to the basic requirements questions.

Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, the libraries is actively maintained and mainly used by TripleO projects

Is the library good code?

Yes the libraries is covered by CI and Unit tests

Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes

Is the library license compatible?

Yes

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

Yes

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?

No

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure
setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?

Yes, it's required for python-tripleoclient and TripleO projects

If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does it use
the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

Yes

Do I need to update anything else?

No.

Change-Id: Iec6b639fce37135f8840240b5d2a1a168bf9bb4e

commit_message:
Add validations-libs to the global-requirements

tripleoclient needs the validations-libs as dependencie, we need to
add the validations-libs to the global-requirements:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714629/

Answers to the basic requirements questions.

Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, the libraries is actively maintained and mainly used by TripleO projects

Is the library good code?

Yes the libraries is covered by CI and Unit tests

Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes

Is the library license compatible?

Yes

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

Yes

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?

No

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or infrastructure
setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?

Yes, it's required for python-tripleoclient and TripleO projects

If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does it use
the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

Yes

Do I need to update anything else?

No.

Change-Id: Iec6b639fce37135f8840240b5d2a1a168bf9bb4e

However, nowadays this path is already part of syspath

commit_message:
Use horizon native wsgi app

The only difference between our and native wsgi app
were adding extra path [1] to sys.path.
However, nowadays this path is already part of syspath

[1] /openstack/venvs/horizon-20.1.1.dev7/lib/python3.6

Change-Id: I90a502fbdeb0040832b66e9df389ab3517b951f4

commit_message:
[FIX] Add whitelisting of fields of various types to configMap.

This Patch Set enables whitelisting of proper field names
of different types(i.e string, integer)in configMap volume.
It makes the pauseImage for daemonjob configurable.

Change-Id: Ia2062c5bc9ba1d8783e9573d7f9ea315c34f7fe7

commit_message:
Fix rados linking for py3

This patch detects correct lib path of gnocchi and use it for symlink
destination

Change-Id: I7b88a053ac5d779bc53a32c1294e76e2233cdd9e

commit_message:
buildah: allow images without type

"binary" is only useful for Kolla images. But in TripleO we don't build
anything else so we could get rid of the type in the name to make the
image names more simple to read.

Change-Id: I8eeb32709fb7dd53d1542803e4a1eb623664671d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-04 13:25:15.000000000', 'message': 'Use more reliable way to get mysql version

mysqladmin --version displays version of client instead of server one.
So we should make decision to run mysql upgrade or not based
on the server version. Also this task should be ran only when mariadb
is already deployed.
This will make possible to be more independent from client version.

Change-Id: Icd20b8c81337d37fba219aa6be482b391bdaedde
'}]
commit_message:
Use more reliable way to get mysql version

mysqladmin --version displays version of client instead of server one.
So we should make decision to run mysql upgrade or not based
on the server version. Also this task should be ran only when mariadb
is already deployed.
This will make possible to be more independent from client version.

Change-Id: Icd20b8c81337d37fba219aa6be482b391bdaedde

commit_message:
Remove apt-cacher-ng cleanup tasks

The apt-cache was removed a long time ago and these tasks should
already have been removed in the Train release. Remove them now.
There is no change for existing deployments as these tasks are no
longer required as the apt-cache component of the repo server is already
retired.

Change-Id: I42785ee153955eb6e72bef01c26791ae8eec2087

subject: Copy Volume v2 commands and unit tests to v3
messages:
[{'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-11-19 19:48:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-01-08 21:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Pretty much a procedural copy/paste, so looks good to me. Some references to v2 that I think would be good to clean up, but that would be fine as a follow up.

IIRC, there are also some places in the v2 code that handle v3 compatiblity, so those would also be good to clean up in a future patch.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2020-01-13 16:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2020-01-13 21:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-01-13 22:47:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-01-13 22:48:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Had to do a little cleanup due to the updated flake8-import-order enforcing the use of unittest.mock instead of the third party mock library.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2020-01-13 23:46:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Just a drive-by review: there don't seem to be any doc pages for volume v3. And all but two of the volume* pages are currently hardcoded (looks like I was probably still intending to get to it in the generate-docs series [1] but hadn't started on it yet). Ultimately I think we should do a full split-by-version like identity [2] and image [3] for the reasons noted therein.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:generate-docs+(status:open+OR+status:merged)
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692931/
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693025/"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2020-01-14 15:44:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'll drop this back into the queue to dupe the v3 RST pages, I don't have the time to do the whole docs re-vamp."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2020-05-06 18:12:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This should be done at some point, certainly when converting volume v3 to SDK...'}]

commit_message:
Copy Volume v2 commands and unit tests to v3

This should complete the duplication of the Volume v3 command
implementations to allow divergence as v3 continues to expand
without disrupting v2.

This is the second of a series of reviews to completely separate
Volume v2 and v3 commands.  Once these are split we can begin to
implement v3 microversion support and/or start using the
OpenStack SDK as the REST library.

Change-Id: Ib3bb4ac6182e776722a57bdf0e8ef87bbdc4d60d
Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add monasca agent plugin to monitor cassandra health

Adds detection plugin to monitor cassandra service, including
the process, and the data directory through the args.

Change-Id: Ic2c20bc878527f607c0eb871e98a79c1521c0507
Story: 2001499

subject: Add --errexit option to pass to interactive mode
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-18 00:10:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add --errexit option to pass to interactive mode

Add --errexit|-e option to exit interactive mode on a command error.
The actual implementation is in cliff, this is written to not die
if an older cliff is present.

This is a companion to https://review.openstack.org/511971 although
it is not dependant on it, the option has no effect without it but
does not fail.

Change-Id: I73c19d3047f9095323f5b355f41f69276f2c8cf7
'}]
commit_message:
Add --errexit option to pass to interactive mode

Add --errexit|-e option to exit interactive mode on a command error.
The actual implementation is in cliff, this is written to not die
if an older cliff is present.

This is a companion to https://review.openstack.org/511971 although
it is not dependant on it, the option has no effect without it but
does not fail.

Change-Id: I73c19d3047f9095323f5b355f41f69276f2c8cf7

subject: [Compute]Make column content readable for both human and machine
messages: [{'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-05-13 22:45:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-05-14 02:17:32.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1538015 to osc4'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-20 13:12:28.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from osc4 to osc5'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2020-05-06 18:11:50.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-13 22:45:26.000000000', 'message': "[Compute]Make column content readable for both human and machine

Currently, we use utils.format_dict(), utils.format_list(),
utils.format_list_of_dicts to make column value can be easy to read by
human, but osc support to format the CLI output into several format,
like: json, shell, csv, yaml, most of these should be understand by
program and code, so keeping the column content as the original value
make sense, like {u'name': u'RuiChen'} than name='RuiChen'

The patch include all compute commands.

Change-Id: I9dbac8551464cd7e5f43f5f60c099a98c2c25624
Implements: blueprint osc-formattable-columns
Partial-Bug: #1538015
Partial-Bug: #1538006
"}]
commit_message:
[Compute]Make column content readable for both human and machine

Currently, we use utils.format_dict(), utils.format_list(),
utils.format_list_of_dicts to make column value can be easy to read by
human, but osc support to format the CLI output into several format,
like: json, shell, csv, yaml, most of these should be understand by
program and code, so keeping the column content as the original value
make sense, like {u'name': u'RuiChen'} than name='RuiChen'

The patch include all compute commands.

Change-Id: I9dbac8551464cd7e5f43f5f60c099a98c2c25624
Implements: blueprint osc-formattable-columns
Partial-Bug: #1538015
Partial-Bug: #1538006

commit_message:
See if we can speed up creating projects/users/roles

DevStack has not kept up with OSC abilities to a) not required IDs for
every last thing, and b) cleanly not error out when creating resources.

Let's try batching all of the keystone setup calls to OSC into a single
call; errors here are fatal anyway so we don't risk much.

Change-Id: I430aaeaecbab3e07d85ab331da727f3f6433feb8

commit_message:
Add flavor value options

Add --ram, --disk, --vcpus options to:
* flavor list to filter results
* server create to select a flavor for the new server

The flavor list command uses the same selection criteria so the user
can verify which flavor will be selected.

Change-Id: I5f4ff2c75767821674f2216081db34e22540496b

commit_message:
Added aggregate VM counts to livbirt check

This commit adds aggregate metrics to the libvirt check that
report the numbers and percentages of VMs by VM state, plus a
total of VMs on the host. These aggregate metrics make it
easier to visualize VM metrics in Grafana, which is good at
aggregating over time but very bad at aggregating over multi
dimensional (host, VM) state metrics.

Change-Id: I5e553b933bb0ac49ca7fb2e7835ca3cc6aaa7ca3

commit_message:
Remove git deamon functionality

Caching git repositories has been deprecated in Queens, so it's high time
we removed this functionality.
This shouldn't influece OSA deployments in any way.

Change-Id: I35829aa35489f06dbb3b65f522f0a08318eccbfa

commit_message:
Use mock from unittest

Since mock is part of unittest std lib now, we can just use it and
remove the external dependency.

Change-Id: Id71c701b8053af5f8ab26c9f6fa66140e76aa8fc

commit_message:
Remove CI for fedora-latest

The fedora-latest build is broken on master and stable branches. OSA
do not support depoyment on Fedora so this job is removed to allow
other code to merge.

This is a combined patch including https://review.opendev.org/725468
in order to unbreak the CI jobs on the train branch

Change-Id: Iee174f76d732941ef97b75612c1420c3dee335f3
(cherry picked from commit cb7ace691883a6a7bef84b2c3652c0f26be91feb)

Setting `lxc_container_config_list` will have precedence over

commit_message:
Set apparmor statement based on LXC version used

We rely on mapping inside lxc-containers-create role while we have
a variable defined with correct version of lxc. So we can set key
correctly here.

Change-Id: Ic9c6287e43737fb2dc6f833dd6e2adff02066f10

commit_message:
Use tempest_plugins Zuul CI role

Instead of setting TEMPEST_PLUGINS for the ironic-tempest-plugin
location let's use the `tempest_plugins` role to add our plugin.

Change-Id: Ie47014c6edb3582932f9fb4b20dc7f9187337027

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: Ie67f30e91d618e40205e14fc0e93bf50c72383b8

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: If7a40e2ffcebb08b781e7f2177400b984fe1d68b

a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- pointing nrpe to  cs:~openstack-charmers-next/nrpe for disco serie
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: Ia73f9f61c3eb92cb26c5cefb2799be72f0cb381f

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I8f764e9ba46a4e2055be61eb0fe97d155ab1c70e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

> Is there a way to reproduce the failure reported in the bug in the
 > unit test env to show that the proposed fix resolves the problem?

Not really in a super meaningful way, IMHO. We can write a unit test that basically checks that the parent backport is run for this one object, but it would only really be a super targeted "confirm we removed this code" sort of test. We could write something more complicated which really just tests more of the base o.vo infrastructure, but happens to have one of these objects in the chain and then confirm we got back some versions we expected, but it'd still be rather contrived. When we stopped doing this nova-specific behavior and started relying on the generic code in o.vo, we didn't add a bunch of tests in nova to validate all the code we removed in all the other objects.

Maybe I'm not being creative enough. What do you have in mind?'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-05-05 07:50:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-21 15:20:13.000000000', 'message': "Remove stale nested backport from InstancePCIRequests

Sometime in 2015, we removed the hard-coded obj_relationships mapping
from parent objects which facilitated semi-automated child version
backports.  This was replaced by a manifest-of-versions mechanism
where the client reports all the supported objects and versions
during a backport request to conductor. The InstancePCIRequests object
isn't technically an ObjectListBase, despite acting like one, and thus
wasn't using the obj_relationships. Because of this, it was doing
its own backporting of its child object, which was not removed in
the culling of the static mechanism. Because we now no longer need to
worry about sub-object backport chaining, when version 1.2 was added,
no backport rule was added, and since the object does not call the
base class' generic routine, proper backporting of the child object
was not happening.

All we need to do is remove the override to allow the base
infrastructure to do the work.

Change-Id: Id610a24c066707de5ddc0507e7ef26c421ba366c
Closes-Bug: #1868033
"}]
commit_message:
Remove stale nested backport from InstancePCIRequests

Sometime in 2015, we removed the hard-coded obj_relationships mapping
from parent objects which facilitated semi-automated child version
backports.  This was replaced by a manifest-of-versions mechanism
where the client reports all the supported objects and versions
during a backport request to conductor. The InstancePCIRequests object
isn't technically an ObjectListBase, despite acting like one, and thus
wasn't using the obj_relationships. Because of this, it was doing
its own backporting of its child object, which was not removed in
the culling of the static mechanism. Because we now no longer need to
worry about sub-object backport chaining, when version 1.2 was added,
no backport rule was added, and since the object does not call the
base class' generic routine, proper backporting of the child object
was not happening.

All we need to do is remove the override to allow the base
infrastructure to do the work.

Change-Id: Id610a24c066707de5ddc0507e7ef26c421ba366c
Closes-Bug: #1868033

subject: ipv6-radvd - resolve mtu from provisioning network
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-05 17:27:29.000000000', 'message': 'ipv6-radvd - resolve mtu from provisioning network

Currently the advertized MTU is hardcoded to 1450.
1450 is to high in case of geneve tunnels on a net
with mtu of 1500 in the underlay.

Automatically get the mtu from the network via the
port on the provisioning network.

Change-Id: I0725b6357bda6219ca49127184f6121167f4f319
'}]
commit_message:
ipv6-radvd - resolve mtu from provisioning network

Currently the advertized MTU is hardcoded to 1450.
1450 is to high in case of geneve tunnels on a net
with mtu of 1500 in the underlay.

Automatically get the mtu from the network via the
port on the provisioning network.

Change-Id: I0725b6357bda6219ca49127184f6121167f4f319

testtools was used to provide a smoother transition to Python 3.
fixtures seems no longer actively maintained and is mostly redundant.

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6b4f94d7345e85f250882eb46d72e5a50df89665

commit_message:
[OVN] Enable test_multicast_between_vms_on_same_network

This patch is adding support on DevStack and zuul job to enable the
test_multicast_between_vms_on_same_network test in the upstream gate.

Change-Id: I0ee5c3daceb34b6810165c1e8a20aa3d5f21c74b
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove CI for fedora-latest

The fedora-latest build is broken on master and stable branches. OSA
do not support depoyment on Fedora so this job is removed to allow
other code to merge.

Change-Id: Iee174f76d732941ef97b75612c1420c3dee335f3

Improve order of OpenStack upgrades

1. neutron-gateway before nova-compute
2. ceph-mon before ceph-osd
