I am aware of the security issues...however, so far this seems to be the only way possible to bypass this issue (in a simple way), the other option is to change all the ceph tripleo-ansible roles to not create anything under /var/lib/mistral'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-04-15 21:08:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-04-15 21:10:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2020-04-15 22:17:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> I am aware of the security issues...however, so far this seems to
 > be the only way possible to bypass this issue (in a simple way),
 > the other option is to change all the ceph tripleo-ansible roles to
 > not create anything under /var/lib/mistral

I am trying to remove some unnecessary use of "become" in the ceph-ansible roles [1] but on my freshly deployed env, while /var/lib/mistral is owned by 42430, the ceph-ansible subdir in it (and all its contents) is owned by tripleo-admin

we don't use become to tripleo-admin admin in the ceph roles; I suspect this must be due to the way how we call the external deploy tasks even though I couldn't find the root cause yet

1. https://review.opendev.org/720306'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-04-16 12:08:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> > I am aware of the security issues...however, so far this seems to
 > > be the only way possible to bypass this issue (in a simple way),
 > > the other option is to change all the ceph tripleo-ansible roles
 > to
 > > not create anything under /var/lib/mistral
 > 
 > I am trying to remove some unnecessary use of "become" in the
 > ceph-ansible roles [1] but on my freshly deployed env, while
 > /var/lib/mistral is owned by 42430, the ceph-ansible subdir in it
 > (and all its contents) is owned by tripleo-admin
 > 
 > we don't use become to tripleo-admin admin in the ceph roles; I
 > suspect this must be due to the way how we call the external deploy
 > tasks even though I couldn't find the root cause yet
 > 
 > 1. https://review.opendev.org/720306

But could you check the rights you have in that environment for /var/lib/mistral? They are 0755 right? So, if we are already deploying with unsecure rights...why are we now concerned about this patch? If we start setting 0750 for /var/lib/mistral from now onwards the deployment will fail misserably for Queens (and older releases)'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2020-04-16 22:04:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> > > I am aware of the security issues...however, so far this seems
 > to
 > > > be the only way possible to bypass this issue (in a simple
 > way),
 > > > the other option is to change all the ceph tripleo-ansible
 > roles
 > > to
 > > > not create anything under /var/lib/mistral
 > >
 > > I am trying to remove some unnecessary use of "become" in the
 > > ceph-ansible roles [1] but on my freshly deployed env, while
 > > /var/lib/mistral is owned by 42430, the ceph-ansible subdir in it
 > > (and all its contents) is owned by tripleo-admin
 > >
 > > we don't use become to tripleo-admin admin in the ceph roles; I
 > > suspect this must be due to the way how we call the external
 > deploy
 > > tasks even though I couldn't find the root cause yet
 > >
 > > 1. https://review.opendev.org/720306
 > 
 > But could you check the rights you have in that environment for
 > /var/lib/mistral? They are 0755 right? So, if we are already
 > deploying with unsecure rights...why are we now concerned about
 > this patch? If we start setting 0750 for /var/lib/mistral from now
 > onwards the deployment will fail misserably for Queens (and older
 > releases)

confirmed

```
[root@undercloud-0 mistral]# ls -la
total 16
drwxr-xr-x.  6 42430 42430  133 Apr 15 17:08 .
drwxr-xr-x. 71 root  root  4096 Apr  7 16:14 ..
drwxr-xr-x.  2 42430 42430 4096 Apr 15 17:07 ansible_fact_cache
lrwxrwxrwx.  1 42430 42430   26 Apr 15 17:08 config-download-latest -> /var/lib/mistral/overcloud
drwxr-xr-x.  3 42430 42430   78 Apr  7 15:15 .novaclient
drwxr-xr-x. 11 42430 42430 4096 Apr 15 22:13 overcloud
drwx------.  2 42430 42430   31 Apr  7 14:56 .ssh
-r--r--r--.  1 42430 42430 1078 Apr  7 14:56 undercloud.conf
[root@undercloud-0 mistral]# 
```

I think we might want to figure why the inner ceph-ansible dir and its contents are tripleo-admin owned instead and eventually fix that but going 751 for now seems to let us proceed at least'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-04-16 22:09:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

So I deployed an older train version and /var/lib/mistral is 755.  Did we lock it down eventually which lead to this?'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2020-04-16 22:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> So I deployed an older train version and /var/lib/mistral is 755. 
 > Did we lock it down eventually which lead to this?

I am tempted to say so as well

and I think I understand why the inner ceph-ansible is tripleo-admin owned ... the playbooks are downloaded via mistral in /var/lib/mistral  but their execution happens triggering the playbook against "Undercloud" host [1] so ansible is doing ssh on local node as tripleo-admin as become is false [2]

in fact I wonder how come fresh deployments with 750 can ever work, for any task using "external_deploy"

I think we should either go at least 751 or set become:true not sure if people have preferences?


1. https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/common/deploy-steps.j2#L654
2. https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/common/deploy-steps.j2#L658'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-04-16 22:31:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

So the problem with mixed permissions is that we've also seen errors that when we delete a stack, the /var/lib/mistral/<stack> ends up with bad permissions so it can't be cleaned up. https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1815178"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-04-16 23:00:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

so the ceph-ansible folder has all sorts of mixed permissions in train

http://paste.openstack.org/show/792259/'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2020-04-16 23:51:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> so the ceph-ansible folder has all sorts of mixed permissions in
 > train
 > 
 > http://paste.openstack.org/show/792259/

the only files owned by root are the log files because the ceph-ansible playbook and the nodes-uuid playbook are executed with become:true ; the rest seems owned by tripleo-admin to me, as it is supposed to be

those which don't have the group set to tripleo-admin don't because we used to create them setting user ownership only [1]

I still believe the root issue here is the playbooks being downloaded via mistral action and then executed by logging in via ssh on undercloud as tripleo-admin

1. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/720306/1/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_ceph_work_dir/tasks/prepare.yml"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-17 18:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-17 18:59:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-04-17 19:00:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-04-20 13:37:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-04-20 17:50:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-04-21 10:58:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2020-04-22 12:35:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

call for help

to me it looks like we basically download the playbooks with one user, then run them with another so I am not sure if there is a different way to approach this

I am happy to work on additional changes if we can figure better ways, but if not this looks like the sanest approach to me'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-04-22 15:09:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

Tested it and it solves the issue, but I won't give +2 since it's a change that impacts other areas. Leaving it the merge for other reviewers"}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2020-04-28 10:47:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-04-28 11:11:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

can't wait to see that service being dropped :)"}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2020-05-05 11:42:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-05-05 12:30:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-05-05 12:31:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

I would like somebody from DF to give their blessing +W'ing it."}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-05-06 09:37:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

[{'created': '2020-04-03 15:07:49.000000000', 'message': 'Make /var/lib/mistral traversable by all users

Some tasks in tripleo-ansible (like tripleo_ceph_work_dir/tasks/prepare.yml)
need to be able to run the global inventory from /var/lib/mistral/$id and
refer to it using {{ playbook_dir }} so we need to make the directory
traversable by the ansible_ssh user

refer to it using {{ playbook_dir }} so we need to make the directory
traversable by the ansible_ssh user

Closes-Bug: #1873081
Change-Id: I388b353e5a1f0b79a711ef5c97d0f3ae8b0de44c
'}]
commit_message:
Make /var/lib/mistral traversable by all users

Some tasks in tripleo-ansible (like tripleo_ceph_work_dir/tasks/prepare.yml)
need to be able to run the global inventory from /var/lib/mistral/$id and
refer to it using {{ playbook_dir }} so we need to make the directory
traversable by the ansible_ssh user

Closes-Bug: #1873081
Change-Id: I388b353e5a1f0b79a711ef5c97d0f3ae8b0de44c

commit_message:
Do not copy /sbin/ip to /usr/bin/monasa-agent-ip

This patch removes the code that does the copy of /sbin/ip to
/usr/bin/monasca-agent-ip. There is a limitation with /sbin/ip
that limits copying it to a new name that is longer than
2 characters. The error is:

./monasca-agent-ip a
Object "nasca-agent-ip" is unknown, try "ip help".

As this is not working on RHEL,SLES, or Ubuntu this code
should be removed.

Change-Id: I439be00070eb1cf16416325f23a86fc7cd518acc
Story: 2001593
Task: 6543
(cherry picked from commit 17ba1346b7d3cdc6914442465ed172518cb81d30)

commit_message:
Do not copy /sbin/ip to /usr/bin/monasa-agent-ip

This patch removes the code that does the copy of /sbin/ip to
/usr/bin/monasca-agent-ip. There is a limitation with /sbin/ip
that limits copying it to a new name that is longer than
2 characters. The error is:

./monasca-agent-ip a
Object "nasca-agent-ip" is unknown, try "ip help".

As this is not working on RHEL,SLES, or Ubuntu this code
should be removed.

Change-Id: I439be00070eb1cf16416325f23a86fc7cd518acc
Story: 2001593
Task: 6543
(cherry picked from commit 17ba1346b7d3cdc6914442465ed172518cb81d30)

commit_message:
Add tox option to run integration-gui (selenium not headless)

- Add a new section in tox.ini to run: tox -e integration-gui
This is mostly usefull to debug integration tests in GUI mode.

- Fix os.environ.get() of IS_SELENIUM_HEADLESS and AVCONV_INSTALLED,
that were always set to True, even when tox/environment value was 0.

- Fix DISPLAY to use current xorg display (e.g. when DISPLAY=:99.0).

- Fix xdpyinfo try-except, separating dimensions.decode() and split().

Change-Id: Icd43215a79581476a090def683da6cc84455d5f9

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-21 16:58:59.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo-redhat-enforce new role to enforce RHOSP constraints.

OSP, the downstream version of tripleo have to enforce some policies
for rhel version and subscribed channel.

This module hosts thoses requirements, so that we prevent update to
wrong rhel release or subscription to wrong channels.

Currently it only implements a basic check to the subscribed rhel
version.

This check has some failsafe logic to avoid crashing the update on
temporary network issue when running subscription-manager.

We are avoiding the validation framework as this can be easily
disabled and we want this enforcement to be mandatory as this could
lead user to unsupported combinaison of OSP/RHEL.

For upstream that change is transparent as the tasks are skipped if
the ansible_distribution is not Red Hat.

For Red Hat, there will be a mechanism in THT to avoid the check
altogether, for instance for CI purposes.

For this first check (RHEL/OSP version), downstream patches will add
the required values in vars/redhat.yml.

Note about the backport, there is a role naming change relative to
master, we use "-" instead of "_" in train for the role directory.

Change-Id: I2d1ac92ee6ee8407fb156a2718f94ad3e9220bbe
(cherry picked from commit ed3511d85cbab0db0b53c43f5cf8790cbea72b55)
'}, {'created': '2020-04-21 22:29:45.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo-redhat-enforce new role to enforce RHOSP constraints.

OSP, the downstream version of tripleo have to enforce some policies
for rhel version and subscribed channel.

This module hosts thoses requirements, so that we prevent update to
wrong rhel release or subscription to wrong channels.

Currently it only implements a basic check to the subscribed rhel
version.

This check has some failsafe logic to avoid crashing the update on
temporary network issue when running subscription-manager.

We are avoiding the validation framework as this can be easily
disabled and we want this enforcement to be mandatory as this could
lead user to unsupported combinaison of OSP/RHEL.

For upstream that change is transparent as the tasks are skipped if
the ansible_distribution is not Red Hat.

For Red Hat, there will be a mechanism in THT to avoid the check
altogether, for instance for CI purposes.

For this first check (RHEL/OSP version), downstream patches will add
the required values in vars/redhat.yml.

Note about the backport, there is a role naming change relative to
master, we use "-" instead of "_" in train for the role directory.

Change-Id: I2d1ac92ee6ee8407fb156a2718f94ad3e9220bbe
(cherry picked from commit 5f8c204fe2bf920bce46476838701ec36d1f8e87)
'}, {'created': '2020-04-21 22:45:28.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo-redhat-enforce new role to enforce RHOSP constraints.

OSP, the downstream version of tripleo have to enforce some policies
for rhel version and subscribed channel.

This module hosts thoses requirements, so that we prevent update to
wrong rhel release or subscription to wrong channels.

Currently it only implements a basic check to the subscribed rhel
version.

This check has some failsafe logic to avoid crashing the update on
temporary network issue when running subscription-manager.

We are avoiding the validation framework as this can be easily
disabled and we want this enforcement to be mandatory as this could
lead user to unsupported combinaison of OSP/RHEL.

For upstream that change is transparent as the tasks are skipped if
the ansible_distribution is not Red Hat.

For Red Hat, there will be a mechanism in THT to avoid the check
altogether, for instance for CI purposes.

For this first check (RHEL/OSP version), downstream patches will add
the required values in vars/redhat.yml.

Note about the backport, there is a role naming change relative to
master, we use "-" instead of "_" in train for the role directory.
The role directory has to be renamed. Documentation is pointing
to molecule/playbook.yml and not molecule/converge.yml.

Change-Id: I2d1ac92ee6ee8407fb156a2718f94ad3e9220bbe
(cherry picked from commit 5f8c204fe2bf920bce46476838701ec36d1f8e87)

commit_message:
tripleo-redhat-enforce new role to enforce RHOSP constraints.

OSP, the downstream version of tripleo have to enforce some policies
for rhel version and subscribed channel.

This module hosts those requirements, so that we prevent update to
wrong rhel release or subscription to wrong channels.

Currently it only implements a basic check to the subscribed rhel
version.

This check has some fail-safe logic to avoid crashing the update on
temporary network issue when running subscription-manager.

We are avoiding the validation framework as this can be easily
disabled and we want this enforcement to be mandatory as this could
lead user to unsupported combination of OSP/RHEL.

For upstream that change is transparent as the tasks are skipped if
the ansible_distribution is not Red Hat.

For Red Hat, there will be a mechanism in THT to avoid the check
altogether, for instance for CI purposes.

For this first check (RHEL/OSP version), downstream patches will add
the required values in vars/redhat.yml.

Note about the backport, there is a role naming change relative to
master, we use "-" instead of "_" in train for the role directory.
The role directory has to be renamed. Documentation is pointing
to molecule/playbook.yml and not molecule/converge.yml.

Change-Id: I2d1ac92ee6ee8407fb156a2718f94ad3e9220bbe
(cherry picked from commit e65996b878a9c758d5b41e996776c68cfe686d29)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-30 23:43:17.000000000', 'message': 'Support new Rhel Enforcement in CI.

Starting from 16.0, OSP, the Red Hat version of tripleo, enforce
certain rules between Rhel version and OSP version.

Those checks rely on the Red Hat subscription mechanism.

To support CI when no subscription is apply we need to disable the
enforcement.  This is done by setting SkipRhelEnforcement to True.

So we add code here to disable the check by default for CI.

The new option --enforce-rhel set to yes make it possible to run the
update while keeping the enforcement to test subscribed environment.

Change-Id: Idac7c370aaaed2805787c0b3327bb9b7e91f1561

commit_message:
Support new Rhel Enforcement in CI.

Starting from 16.0, OSP, the Red Hat version of tripleo, enforce
certain rules between Rhel version and OSP version.

Those checks rely on the Red Hat subscription mechanism.

To support CI when no subscription is apply we need to disable the
enforcement.  This is done by setting SkipRhelEnforcement to True.

So we add code here to disable the check by default for CI.

The new option --enforce-rhel set to yes make it possible to run the
update while keeping the enforcement to test subscribed environment.

Change-Id: Idac7c370aaaed2805787c0b3327bb9b7e91f1561

commit_message:
Fix padding logic for UDP health daemon

Should have done "pad to 8 characters" on the hex conversion, but it was
instead hardcoded to pad a single `0`, which is right in a lot of cases
but not all.

For example:
>>> ip1 = ipaddress.ip_address('98.136.140.23')
>>> ip2 = ipaddress.ip_address('10.1.1.1')
>>> "%X" % ip1._ip
'62888C17'
>>> "%X" % ip2._ip
'A010101'

Change-Id: Ia9fec4e72c00f7086489b245d9dc50ed9c27f12a
(cherry picked from commit d27ee3f0ee98934e6ab354704edc47f61fffdcda)

commit_message:
Fix the amphora noop driver

The amphora no-op driver did not get updated properly for the multi-amphora
failover fix.
This patch fixes that issue and corrects the doc strings for the
haproxy amphora driver update_amphora_listeners method.

Change-Id: Ib0d63da7c5599069f5ea50f0dfbc59eefba58c84
(cherry picked from commit c8074cd18a8c6ccdae7a490c8e9615acc2cadaf4)

commit_message:
Add a periodic image build job

This patch adds a periodic job to build the amphora image using the
released version of diskimage-builder (our other jobs use Git master).
This job will not publish the produced image, it is only to test the
build.

Change-Id: I611d9cd5a519abc6a330ec2c46a2f5a1fdb89313
(cherry picked from commit 1f9915037ad68356231691607b461c30b28df3b7)

commit_message:
Remove duplicate entry of collectd-python package

https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-collectd/commit/672452018abefde44f18de9cb75a3102e0745f61
in puppet-collectd adds supports of CentOS-8 and collect-python
package is already defined there.

In puppet-tripleo, it started complaining about duplicate entry of
collectd-python package, removing the same fixes for puppet-tripleo
fixes the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1866965

Change-Id: If1a2c65c4208c2255a3140134204e240496ec8b6
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

I have the following questions:

- how did you choose the proposed min version? we have python-memcached>=1.59 in test-requirements.txt, but you proposed 1.56 as the min version.

- Installation via setup.cfg extras does not honor upper-constraints.txt. It potentially breaks our gate. How should we handle it?

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-29 17:59:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix up the test-paths to be more obvious

There's "magic" in the zaza package that converts charm names to paths
for the charm under test.  However, it is poorly understood, and most
charms use the relative path.  This patchset does that.  Overlays
complicate that picture, but this charm doesn't use overlays.

Change-Id: Ic558c952359a5e5f60125452433d7b0588d0a1c4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix up the test-paths to be more obvious

There's "magic" in the zaza package that converts charm names to paths
for the charm under test.  However, it is poorly understood, and most
charms use the relative path.  This patchset does that.  Overlays
complicate that picture, but this charm doesn't use overlays.

Change-Id: Ic558c952359a5e5f60125452433d7b0588d0a1c4

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I0b4cd548008938c9f8ba1a4bb92b9d1319ce55c7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
CI: exclude the inspection abort tests from the inspector-redfish-vmedia job

Everything seems to happen quite slowly in this job, so the abort test gets
hit by "node locked" problem way too often. It's not critical for this job,
so let's make the test regex narrower.

Also increase build timeouts.

Change-Id: Ie0acb5d459553a40ee45dd78f5c4b290b673f093

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I431937171057f85b2da87efd25ca17a41e82d2b5

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-29 13:24:05.000000000', 'message': "CI: repair the SNMP job and make it voting.

The SNMP hardware type does not have a management interface, thus
it's impossible to switch boot device to local. Keep using netboot.

As a nice side effect, this job will keep testing whole disk images
with network boot.

Make the job voting since it's pretty stable when we don't break it.

Change-Id: I559fdccfbaf02396a0a096c50fbb9660c22a4dee
"}]
commit_message:
CI: repair the SNMP job and make it voting.

The SNMP hardware type does not have a management interface, thus
it's impossible to switch boot device to local. Keep using netboot.

As a nice side effect, this job will keep testing whole disk images
with network boot.

Make the job voting since it's pretty stable when we don't break it.

Change-Id: I559fdccfbaf02396a0a096c50fbb9660c22a4dee

commit_message:
Remove Babel requirement

Babel is no longer a requirement for OpenStack projects.
Let's remove it and save some disk space.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014227.html

Change-Id: Ide1a76f05867188ef65b69fe151cdf8e7f77ce94

commit_message:
Remove mocking of functools.partial

This, along with the usage of unittest.mock, is breaking
the python3.8 unit test jobs.  Just remove it as we're
really not losing much in test verification.

Change-Id: I5fbcc56f32f824cb52895a3f42e5a4dabe209ac2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-04 21:54:43.000000000', 'message': 'Allow for multiple instantiations of mysql-router

Before this change it was not possible to run more than one
instantiation of mysql-router on a single unit. The Nova cells
deployments require nova-cloud-controller to be connected to two
different databases, therefore, requiring two instantiations of
mysql-router.

This change includes all the necessary steps to run multiple
instantiations of mysql-router on a single unit.

Review and merge charm-helpers PR:
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/469

Closes-Bug: #1876188
Depends-On: Iafcc106fca44479e89b4b66a0a3988ffeee01f04
Change-Id: I76d1bfdccf9a551188c9f86c06ee0a22c07d47cf
'}]
commit_message:
Allow for multiple instantiations of mysql-router

Before this change it was not possible to run more than one
instantiation of mysql-router on a single unit. The Nova cells
deployments require nova-cloud-controller to be connected to two
different databases, therefore, requiring two instantiations of
mysql-router.

This change includes all the necessary steps to run multiple
instantiations of mysql-router on a single unit.

Review and merge charm-helpers PR:
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/469

Closes-Bug: #1876188
Depends-On: Iafcc106fca44479e89b4b66a0a3988ffeee01f04
Change-Id: I76d1bfdccf9a551188c9f86c06ee0a22c07d47cf

commit_message:
Update grenade job

- added LIBVIRT_STORAGE_POOL_PATH since some cloud providers
may not have enough disk space.
- added IRONIC_TEMPEST_BUILD_TIMEOUT
- changed tempest tests to use Inspector regex
- lowered the number of VMs to 2 (we don't have many tests)

Change-Id: I5e35f9c4f123beef4e5933a502d8ed59708242b2

commit_message:
migration: Replace paunch with podman and ip commands

The patch removes paunch and cleans network namespaces by iterating over
namespaces belonging to Neutron agents. It also clears side-car
containers spawned by Neutron using podman command.

Change-Id: I017e7b3c3674e065a523eff5ebbea352f619f45e

subject: Use shared volume for side-car wrapper locks
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 21798, 'name': 'Bernard Cafarelli', 'email': 'bcafarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcafarel'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28223, 'name': 'Cedric Jeanneret', 'display_name': 'cjeanner (Tengu)', 'email': 'cjeanner@redhat.com', 'username': 'cjeanner'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-29 09:07:55.000000000', 'message': 'Use shared volume for side-car wrapper locks

The lock used in the wrapper is under /var/lock in the container which
is not shared with the host so the sync script never waits for the
wrapper to be done. Moving the lock file to a path on a shared mount in
the container seems to solve that particular race.

Change-Id: I660b7189a9e1c3197f2cdcc77af62584691dde16
Partial-bug: #1874470
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/723522
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Use shared volume for side-car wrapper locks

The lock used in the wrapper is under /var/lock in the container which
is not shared with the host so the sync script never waits for the
wrapper to be done. Moving the lock file to a path on a shared mount in
the container seems to solve that particular race.

Change-Id: I660b7189a9e1c3197f2cdcc77af62584691dde16
Partial-bug: #1874470
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/723522
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Suppress PytestCollectionWarning

pytest complains PytestCollectionWarning when a class name looks
like a test case class ("TestFoo").
We can disable the warning by adding '__test__ = False' but
it looks easier to drop "Test" prefix from such classes.

This commit drops "Test" prefix if we can simpy drop it from
class names. If a class name will be too generic after dropping
"Test" prefix, I renamed such classes from "TestFoo" to "FooForTesting"
as a workaround.

Change-Id: I617ab8462a9dc173e34f4aae899e0b0def6ecdc1

commit_message:
Fix tenant_id for a new port.

To successfully create a port in a shared network which belongs
to a different tenant, the tenant of the new port should be same
as the tenant of a request user.

Closes-bug: #1815461
Change-Id: Ia243f213b23f3f34845de5d97e8eaa5aa6979e76
(cherry picked from commit 3c33f46dc8196809d67301f20c8b920cad03b372)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-03 07:48:17.000000000', 'message': "docs: Clean up mount options

* Stop specifying logbufs=8; that's the default
* Stop including nodiratime with noatime; the latter implies the former

Nothing wrong with being explicit, I suppose, but may as well keep the
mount options to what we can easily explain: we want noatime because
Swift does not use atime, so we don't want to lose any performance to
tracking atime.

Change-Id: I1e52b4368ad7eb375964eee5132bc50297536355
"}]
commit_message:
docs: Clean up mount options

* Stop specifying logbufs=8; that's the default
* Stop including nodiratime with noatime; the latter implies the former

Nothing wrong with being explicit, I suppose, but may as well keep the
mount options to what we can easily explain: we want noatime because
Swift does not use atime, so we don't want to lose any performance to
tracking atime.

Change-Id: I1e52b4368ad7eb375964eee5132bc50297536355

commit_message:
Accept missing memcached_node_ips

Currently when Memcached is disabled in the deployment, puppet-tripleo
fails because some manifests expect that memcached_node_ips is defined
in hieradata.

This patch ensures that we define the default value ([]) for
memcached_node_ips, so that puppet-tripleo doesn't fail even if
the parameter doesn't appear in heradata.

Change-Id: I6d3e32f7f8f0751bdfbd0b6f2e79c5d85e1af284

commit_message:
Monkey patch original current_thread _active

Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active
global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592

Change-Id: I49bfd9673abc7602b27dc48b8b490daaded2882c
Closes-Bug: #1863021
(cherry picked from commit ec7a5aa5161f438736c5a1dcf10f5d0e48f329cd)

messages: [{'account_id': 27215, 'date': '2020-05-06 08:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 17:52:57.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I2a5639f551709c76074f465035752059d3d9ac80
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I2a5639f551709c76074f465035752059d3d9ac80

Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Fix stable gates

Tempest master version is not compatible with env < py3.6 version. Xenial node is py3.5
so we have to use the old version of Tempest which is 23.0.0[1].
We have to do the same for these jobs explicitly as these jobs run on xenial node on stable/stein gate.

Update other branches in same way.

[1]
https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/src/commit/8cd4e9a9076e05974ed1242ccab3391c55c7070c/stackrc#L316

Change-Id: Ibf3737f1f35776705c39ccef8c744b29a2778496

commit_message:
External Ceph: add ceph_*_user variables

To make the configuration easier for the user, and to allow non-standard
ceph authentication ids - introduce ceph_*_user variables.

Change-Id: I24e01c43c826b62b6748d93a498f4b7d8ce9e309

commit_message:
Switch to new grenade job name

The integrated gate template (integrated-gate-py3) has been switched
to the new grenade name (grenade-py3 -> grenade). This repo uses the
template but also has for irrelevant files an extra entry.

Rename the job following the template change to avoid duplicate
grenade runs.

Details:
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014602.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/725148
Change-Id: I52ebbcae0d77c0420848a37babc73bb75dd58e0b

I was just thinking that another Alternative Implementation (which would also be much simpler) would also be to use --labels along with a boolean flag, e.g. (--merge-labels) where --merge-labels=False (default) would give us the current behaviour of replacing all inherited labels and --merge-labels=True would update inherited labels with labels supplied via existing --labels input. This would work for auditing because we would know the policy used to arrive at the final set of labels supplied to Heat but we would need to add a boolean field to the DB and additionally, existing labels field e.g. at the cluster scope could be used to store the labels supplied by the user at this scope. Let me know your thoughts.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-04-06 08:54:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> I was just thinking that another Alternative Implementation (which
 > would also be much simpler) would also be to use --labels along
 > with a boolean flag, e.g. (--merge-labels) where --merge-labels=False
 > (default) would give us the current behaviour of replacing all
 > inherited labels and --merge-labels=True would update inherited
 > labels with labels supplied via existing --labels input. This would
 > work for auditing because we would know the policy used to arrive
 > at the final set of labels supplied to Heat but we would need to
 > add a boolean field to the DB and additionally, existing labels
 > field e.g. at the cluster scope could be used to store the labels
 > supplied by the user at this scope. Let me know your thoughts.

I say this because if we are implementing a behaviour where a user is only allowed to supply --labels or --override-labels field, this introduces a new column in the database where only one of them is ever used.  This is the same as using the same column and using a boolean toggle.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-04-06 09:18:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> (1 comment)

I think it would be good if operators could set the default when no flag specified and users can override with a positive or a negative flag eg. --override and --do-not-override
This is a win win for both operators who can control the default behaviour and for users who can ask for the exact behaviour when they need to.'}, {'account_id': 27057, 'date': '2020-05-05 09:59:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> > (1 comment)
 > 
 > I think it would be good if operators could set the default when no
 > flag specified and users can override with a positive or a negative
 > flag eg. --override and --do-not-override
 > This is a win win for both operators who can control the default
 > behaviour and for users who can ask for the exact behaviour when
 > they need to.

I see the benefit of not having to use a flag all the time. BUT I feel that users should have a way of knowing what the operator chose for them without having to test the API.'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-05-05 10:10:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> > > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > I think it would be good if operators could set the default when
 > no
 > > flag specified and users can override with a positive or a
 > negative
 > > flag eg. --override and --do-not-override
 > > This is a win win for both operators who can control the default
 > > behaviour and for users who can ask for the exact behaviour when
 > > they need to.

Is the a request for change? You agree with the proposed PatchSet?

The quoted comment doesn't appear.

* The default of the magnum API will be false.
* The client will not send anything so the default is applied.
* Special deployments that don't want to stick to the api-reference
can change the default. We can add this opt-in bad practice. It is
API breakage with a config option.

 > 
 > I see the benefit of not having to use a flag all the time. BUT I
 > feel that users should have a way of knowing what the operator
 > chose for them without having to test the API.

Fully agree here. It is a bad practice and the magnum API should not be
advertised as a "conditional" API. Meaning that projects (terraform, heat,
magnum-ui) which interact with magnum should take into account that
the default value is false. In a later released API microversion we
can break the API. 

What if we leave it outside the design SPEC since the magnum API will
have one default? We can document it in admin docs and stress the
risk of breaking an API (it seems it not obvious by everyone that terraform
can work with X behaviour against cloudA and with behaviour Y in cloudB).'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2020-05-05 10:11:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
Magnum Labels Override

This spec tries to address the problem of label overriding during
cluster and nodegroup creation.

Change-Id: Ie93d7faed0e5e68a084cc4e63a49431365efcd72
Story: #2007515
Task: #39298

Monkey patch original current_thread _active

Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active
global variable. This solution is based on that documented at:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592

Change-Id: Ida548b4bec00530418fd3d7ab254e971af77d3fe
Closes-Bug: #1863021

While serving Metadata response for instance we need to find
Logical_Switch_Port from which request was send.

commit_message:
[OVN] Select newest port for metadata answer if multiple LSPs found

While serving Metadata response for instance we need to find
Logical_Switch_Port from which request was send.
For now we're using tuple: client IP Address and Network ID
(added as header from HAProxy).

In case of some inconsistency in the OVN database, there is a
possibility that for same tuple: ip_address and network_id there
is more than one LSP defined.

This patch adds check for existance of 'created_at' field in
port external_ids. If all found ports have this field, then the
newest created port is selected for Metadata answer.

Change-Id: I036f25d10f7873ce327ec011594e44788df1727d
Related-Bug: 1874733

Supported stable branches in maintenance state
(stein, train, ussuri) use the Tempest and plugins master

tests or any changes) is compatible with stable branch testing,

 [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/e8f1876aa6772077f85f380677b30251c2454505/.zuul.yaml#L646

commit_message:
Add stable branch jobs on the plugins master gate

Supported stable branches in maintenance state
(stein, train, ussuri) use the Tempest and plugins master
version for their testing. To make sure master version (new
tests or any changes) is compatible with stable branch testing,
we need to add the stable branches job on the plugins master gate.
Tempest and many other plugins are already testing the stable
branches in same way[1].

Ussuri onwards, Tempest or plugins are py3 only, so we are
running only python3 version of stable jobs

Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

 [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/e8f1876aa6772077f85f380677b30251c2454505/.zuul.yaml#L646

Change-Id: Id7e69347f316fa79f60e7969fee300798397cf89

commit_message:
Add stable branch jobs on the plugins master gate

Supported stable branches in maintenance state
(stein, train, ussuri) use the Tempest and plugins master
version for their testing. To make sure master version (new
tests or any changes) is compatible with stable branch testing,
we need to add the stable branches job on the plugins master gate.
Tempest and many other plugins are already testing the stable
branches in same way[1].

Ussuri onwards, Tempest or plugins are py3 only, so we are
running only python3 version of stable jobs

Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

 [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/e8f1876aa6772077f85f380677b30251c2454505/.zuul.yaml#L646

Change-Id: I5a37c4717b6702c8a47f7a26faa3393a2acd3148

commit_message:
Remove Extended maintainance stable branch job from master gate

stable/queens and stable/rocky are in extended maintainance state
and devtack use the older Tempest version to tests them not the master.

Testing them on master gate is not needed as heat-tempest-plugin master
cannot support testing them due to python required version for plugin
and Tempest. Even we test them on master gate, they run with older Tempest
so they are not actually testing the master code against those stable.

We can continue testing the supported stable branch where master Tempest and
plugins are used.

Same is done Tempest and other plugins side:
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722183/
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707111/

Change-Id: I3dd3c354947461ba65906251fb42897b0b8ce6f5

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-06 08:15:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix: compatibility problem on python3.6

Latest version can't now run on latest ceph/s3tests because of some
compatibility problem of python version.

```
exctype, value, tb = err
return ''.join(traceback.format_exception(exctype, value, tb))
```

value is a string type. But traceback.format_exception refuse to accept
a string as its second parameter in python 3.6
So this change uses traceback.format_tb instead of format_exception.
The output of the two functions are almost the same.

Change-Id: I5a74c83fe6ed5680909f4bdc6cbaedd3ed4bdf3d
Signed-off-by: Pei <huangp0600@126.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-05-06 08:22:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix: compatibility problem on python3.6

Latest version can't now run on latest ceph/s3tests because of some
compatibility problem of python version.

```
exctype, value, tb = err
return ''.join(traceback.format_exception(exctype, value, tb))
```

value is a string type. But traceback.format_exception refuse to accept
a string as its second parameter in python 3.6
So this change uses traceback.format_tb instead of format_exception.
The output of the two functions are almost the same.

Change-Id: I5a74c83fe6ed5680909f4bdc6cbaedd3ed4bdf3d
Signed-off-by: Pei <huangp0600@126.com>
Signed-off-by: Zhiteng Huang <zhithuang@ebaysf.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix: compatibility problem on python3.6

Latest version can't now run on latest ceph/s3tests because of some
compatibility problem of python version.

```
exctype, value, tb = err
return ''.join(traceback.format_exception(exctype, value, tb))
```

value is a string type. But traceback.format_exception refuse to accept
a string as its second parameter in python 3.6
So this change uses traceback.format_tb instead of format_exception.
The output of the two functions are almost the same.

Change-Id: I5a74c83fe6ed5680909f4bdc6cbaedd3ed4bdf3d
Signed-off-by: Pei <huangp0600@126.com>
Signed-off-by: Zhiteng Huang <zhithuang@ebaysf.com>

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If64fcc4c8b76d84bf0c46e4bec7193d22599ec62

commit_message:
Further py27 cleanup support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Use newer openstackdocstheme and Sphinx versions
- Switch to hacking 3.0, fix problems found

Change-Id: I499bb071847dd006d4045faf2325f588d07b4ffe

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I29f4e42e8288f29e34f35d5e12f5f996c9c91d2f

commit_message:
Add stable branch jobs on the plugins master gate

Supported stable branches in maintenance state
(stein, train, ussuri) use the Tempest and plugins master
version for their testing. To make sure master version (new
tests or any changes) is compatible with stable branch testing,
we need to add the stable branches job on the plugins master gate.
Tempest and many other plugins are already testing the stable
branches in same way[1].

Ussuri onwards, Tempest or plugins are py3 only, so we are
running only python3 version of stable jobs

Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

 [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/e8f1876aa6772077f85f380677b30251c2454505/.zuul.yaml#L646

Change-Id: If109a13873d2ee9ede112952056914dc4c57b4df

Update docs building

Update docs building:
* Switch to sphinx-build
* Update requirements for Sphinx and openstackdocstheme for
  python 3, create doc/requiremetns
* Remove unneeded doc and translation sections from setup.cfg
* Remove install_command, it's unneeded, the default is fine.
* Move constraints to deps, use TOX_CONSTRAINTS instead of obsolete
  UPPER_CONSTRAINTS
* Remove now unneeded placeholder file

Change-Id: I649e6fa86c17262698cc8a01d042a87b020239d9

oh, I don't know"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-05-08 11:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > Can't we detect these things automatically in pep8 job?

> oh, I don't know

If so, what is the value of this patch?
This kind of things can be fixed when the code near them are fixed.
This makes "git blame" difficult.

Or, you can see more complete fix. I see other usage of backslashes
to wrap conditions. We use parentheses ratherr than backslashes
per OpenStack codeing guideline.

I don't put any +2/+1 for now.
For other reviewers, feel free to merge this if you feel it useful.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2019-05-29 10:13:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm sorry, I don't know how to write the rule to check this issue, would you please give an regex pattern?"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-10-06 09:54:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

>
> I'm sorry, I don't know how to write the rule to check this issue,
> would you please give an regex pattern?

You need to explore how to write the rule which cover this issue.
I can provide some pointers on how to write a rule.

- http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/plugin-development/index.html (It would be the best pointer to understand existing hacking rules works.)
- OpenStack hacking rules https://github.com/openstack/hacking/tree/master/hacking/checks (There aree many existing good examples.)"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-10-06 09:55:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2020-05-06 07:19:23.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

* Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS instead of obsolete UPPER_CONSTRAINTS
* Update hacking to 3.0

commit_message:
Fix ipv6 address cannot be parsed in mariadb-ingress pod

There is a bug in nginx.tmpl that it will not enclose ipv6
addresses in square brackets resulting in them being unable to
be parsed.

Test pass on both ipv4 and ipv6 simplex setup for StarlingX
project

Change-Id: I16e586f5d8e3dfcb5e94f0486409c9637ba197b2
Signed-off-by: Zhipeng Liu <zhipengs.liu@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add Python3 victoria unit tests

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for victoria.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: Ib79a6454dd7070832f639469767a807eebe5d12d

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

1. Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.
2. Update some URLs to latest
3. Remove unncessary "=="

See https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/issues/6440 for upstream details

Change-Id: I2b5f5091df91fb76de8a3f89be7f3a67ee25a3d0

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1ba5e8d68d807c9b6dbd3feb3d5abd21a2d8d9d3

[{'created': '2020-04-08 18:21:34.000000000', 'message': 'Change glance haproxy balancing method

In order to support glance-direct interoperable image import method
we need to send both stage and import request to the same backend,
as it stores stageing image on the local storage by default.

Change-Id: I55a6983351f178bdc1eff9db50039010fa03a58b
'}]
commit_message:
Change glance haproxy balancing method

In order to support glance-direct interoperable image import method
we need to send both stage and import request to the same backend,
as it stores stageing image on the local storage by default.

Change-Id: I55a6983351f178bdc1eff9db50039010fa03a58b

commit_message:
Switch to new grenade job name

The integrated gate templates has switched to the new grenade name
(grenade-py3 -> grenade). This repo uses an integrated gate template
but also listed the job for irrelevant files an extra entry.

Rename the job following the template change to avoid duplicate
grenade runs.

Details:
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014602.html

Change-Id: I4afc73301965b582fd338012f0ddc60f9b85fbb0
(cherry picked from commit 69529500700bd3dba575cf0a766737a7184a2121)

commit_message:
Handle the case when tempest fails

Before this change, the errors from tempest run are suppressed
in order to always execute cinderlib tests.

Use the new variable exported by run-tempest instead,
and fail properly if needed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/720213
Change-Id: Ic1fd6fcc9b9183f195c66f0022e913ae9734c97b

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

python-zaqarclient is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: I7df21753bccf435b81b5f42a63845d67fe209a55
(cherry picked from commit 93811d1ab16e3fa9c4c0268a20f6eade6a62659b)

commit_message:
Use ensure-pip for stackviz pip install

Infra is trying to move to nodes that do not come with pip/virtualenv
pre-installed on the image; for details see the spec at [1].

zuul-jobs include ensure-pip [2] to provide pip dependencies; use that
before installing stackviz.  Note that if pip is installed this is a
noop.

[1] https://docs.opendev.org/opendev/infra-specs/latest/specs/cleanup-test-node-python.html
[2] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#role-ensure-pip

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/723762
Change-Id: I24925ab8e885404da64a3ecfca3848041b6dfc05

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Update classifiers
- Use newer openstackdocstheme and Sphinx versions
- Cleanup */source/conf.py to remove now obsolete content.
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine

Change-Id: I623b1e0bfc2ec8cd9ce017556101cdeb06a1bb4c

[{'created': '2020-03-12 00:05:19.000000000', 'message': 'Convert testmatrix run to venv

As part of our efforts to ship bare nodes, we want to install as
little as possible in any sort of pre-run jobs.  Since all infra nodes
have python3 available, use venv to create this small environment for
the test matrix production, and avoid having to pull in any other
dependencies.

Change-Id: Ie8b09ab60841f9d1b15ae1a7afec51906cd89f95
'}]
commit_message:
Convert testmatrix run to venv

As part of our efforts to ship bare nodes, we want to install as
little as possible in any sort of pre-run jobs.  Since all infra nodes
have python3 available, use venv to create this small environment for
the test matrix production, and avoid having to pull in any other
dependencies.

Change-Id: Ie8b09ab60841f9d1b15ae1a7afec51906cd89f95

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Change-Id: I582af8ad8f9a6b05f5a245a155b87be6e2d63874

The python 3.8 unit test jobs are failing on a
mock.Mock(spec=secrets.Secret) call. Since this is legacy code and
we don't really need to be testing python-barbicanclient code here,
I'm removing the spec= for these tests to stop artificial failures
when running unit tests on python 3.8.

Change-Id: I273df95458276947527d927c2fbf464c649a7c28
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Octavia unit tests for python 3.8

The python 3.8 unit test jobs are failing on a
mock.Mock(spec=secrets.Secret) call. Since this is legacy code and
we don't really need to be testing python-barbicanclient code here,
I'm removing the spec= for these tests to stop artificial failures
when running unit tests on python 3.8.

Change-Id: I273df95458276947527d927c2fbf464c649a7c28

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-05 14:49:38.000000000', 'message': "buildah: exclude build and push, not only build

When adding exclude param, we put it in the build but buildah still
tries to pushes the images from exclude. Let's just move it to the
_generate_container method which takes care of both build & push.

Change-Id: I53108786e384215353b5db37b3d5a6d77e0c9d60
"}]
commit_message:
buildah: exclude build and push, not only build

When adding exclude param, we put it in the build but buildah still
tries to pushes the images from exclude. Let's just move it to the
_generate_container method which takes care of both build & push.

Change-Id: I53108786e384215353b5db37b3d5a6d77e0c9d60

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I388184b4c9f7064d00b1278b1a9f5438e4457fcd
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Deprecating Old Dell EMC Xtremio Iscsi Volume Config

Added new Dell EMC Xtremio Volume config that now
supports both iSCSI and FC drivers. https://review.opendev.org/#/c/723025/
Deprecating the old resource.

Change-Id: I0f7b8b4860be4f00e9fe24710143a184b6a3134d

commit_message:
Consume oooci-build-images role in build-image

It contains:
* Remove existing template in favour of oooci-build-images role
* Moved isolated build step code to main playbook
* Added required vars for oooci-build-images role
  in Ansible
* use quickstart-centos and delorean repos for image build
* web-gating.repo is generated when there is a depends-on from
  tripleo projects.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/721178/

Change-Id: Ifebdc0e1d765646faafaed545a9e01cead51a319
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add py38 package metadata

Now that we are running the Victoria tests that include a
voting py38, we can now add the Python 3.8 metadata to the
package information to reflect that support.

Change-Id: Ie131fba4cee8b50612cbba7632079a64ccdd6e75
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-05 22:44:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add stable branch jobs on the plugins master gate

Supported stable branches in maintenance state
(stein, train, ussuri) use the Tempest and plugins master
version for their testing. To make sure master version (new
tests or any changes) is compatible with stable branch testing,
we need to add the stable branches job on the plugins master gate.
Tempest and many other plugins are already testing the stable
branches in same way[1].

Ussuri onwards, Tempest or plugins are py3 only, so we are
running only python3 version of stable jobs

Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

 [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/e8f1876aa6772077f85f380677b30251c2454505/.zuul.yaml#L646

Change-Id: I310ab8ce1f5e6dd34f26a982ecb4b060254f8a9c
'}]
commit_message:
Add stable branch jobs on the plugins master gate

Supported stable branches in maintenance state
(stein, train, ussuri) use the Tempest and plugins master
version for their testing. To make sure master version (new
tests or any changes) is compatible with stable branch testing,
we need to add the stable branches job on the plugins master gate.
Tempest and many other plugins are already testing the stable
branches in same way[1].

Ussuri onwards, Tempest or plugins are py3 only, so we are
running only python3 version of stable jobs

Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

 [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/e8f1876aa6772077f85f380677b30251c2454505/.zuul.yaml#L646

Change-Id: I310ab8ce1f5e6dd34f26a982ecb4b060254f8a9c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 17:41:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add ansible hieradata file

Currently there isn't a good way to pass dynamic information from
ansible to puppet to end up in the configuration. This change adds an
ansible_managed hierafile that can be updated via ansible to pass
dynamic variables into a future puppet execution.

An example playbook would be:

  - name: Set my data
    set_fact:
      my_data: foo
  - name: Add my_data to hieradata
    include_role:
      name: tripleo_hieradata
      tasks_from: ansible_hierdata.yml
    vars:
      hieradata_ansible_data:
        my_magical_var: "{{ my_data }}"

The puppet code that would be executed later would just be:

  class myclass(
    $my_data = lookup('my_magical_var', 'bar')
  ) {
    file { '/var/tmp/data':
      ensure  = present,
      content = $my_data
    }
  }

Change-Id: I52ba520dbdd97b25cb093f7e09609e6e1797e3a1
(cherry picked from commit f8f74e11ce26424004c0af89f29b7d206ab4452a)
'}, {'created': '2020-05-01 13:01:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add ansible hieradata file

commit_message:
Add ansible hieradata file

Currently there isn't a good way to pass dynamic information from
ansible to puppet to end up in the configuration. This change adds an
ansible_managed hierafile that can be updated via ansible to pass
dynamic variables into a future puppet execution.

An example playbook would be:

  - name: Set my data
    set_fact:
      my_data: foo
  - name: Add my_data to hieradata
    include_role:
      name: tripleo_hieradata
      tasks_from: ansible_hierdata.yml
    vars:
      hieradata_ansible_data:
        my_magical_var: "{{ my_data }}"

The puppet code that would be executed later would just be:

  class myclass(
    $my_data = lookup('my_magical_var', 'bar')
  ) {
    file { '/var/tmp/data':
      ensure  = present,
      content = $my_data
    }
  }

Change-Id: I52ba520dbdd97b25cb093f7e09609e6e1797e3a1
(cherry picked from commit f8f74e11ce26424004c0af89f29b7d206ab4452a)

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python 3

In change I3f4216f66606fbc450a46c93de306399b7f3cd65 [1], tempest
updated their use of hacking for Python 3. Among other things, this
removed tempest.hacking.checks.factory, which we consumed. Update our
use of hacking to keep pace, and un-break the gate.

[1] I3f4216f66606fbc450a46c93de306399b7f3cd65

Change-Id: Ia4e0b3cca8cb984900b49804b964d03ea6466191

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-04 23:41:25.000000000', 'message': 'Conditionally restore default route in setup_ipv6

Restoring the default IPv6 route is not needed in CI and
fails when there are multiple defaults, but it is useful
in local devstacks where multiple default routes are not
typical.

Add a variable in settings and use it to make this behavior
conditional and set it to False for the lvm job.

Closes-bug: #1836788
Change-Id: Id73de8100509ec5935641f5f35f93f482d108bcd
(cherry picked from commit 70e908344dd4db81652264a2de2c04ce9666bb46)
'}]
commit_message:
Conditionally restore default route in setup_ipv6

Restoring the default IPv6 route is not needed in CI and
fails when there are multiple defaults, but it is useful
in local devstacks where multiple default routes are not
typical.

Add a variable in settings and use it to make this behavior
conditional and set it to False for the lvm job.

Closes-bug: #1836788
Change-Id: Id73de8100509ec5935641f5f35f93f482d108bcd
(cherry picked from commit 70e908344dd4db81652264a2de2c04ce9666bb46)

commit_message:
ensure default security group exists when filter by project_id

now filter security groups by tenant_id, will auto ensure default security
group, but project_id not. tenant_id is deprecated, we are used to filtering
by project_id.

Closes-bug: #1875849

Change-Id: I3f1a2698768e2d66811bb290a892a1b089dff4ed

Add a /healthcheck URL

The /healthcheck is helpful for operators to setup neutron-api
behind haproxy, or for doing monitoring.

commit_message:
Check task_state of instance before volume actions

Check task_state before verify resize or before detachment.

We need to make sure the task_state moved out from resize_finish before
we trigger some action like attach/detach volume.

So when we update flvor and volume at the samethime, the resize action
will not affect volume attachment/detachment.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700512/

Change-Id: I64033d5a0a8fea5c4fd93b1deb111d3d8fba0cf7
Story: #2007042
Task: #37854
Task: #37855
Task: #37869
(cherry picked from commit 40ca7e9e633b112b868069e41ebeeea7cd06c4db)

commit_message:
Create new project for OpenDev Engagement Stats

Initialize a fresh repository to hold tooling used for generating
coarse-grained reports of aggregate collaboration activity from
publicly available APIs and archives provided by OpenDev hosted
services.

Change-Id: Idfc6007516b3446541e830db0120a0801f17303e

subject: Use python3 for stackviz
messages:
[{'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2020-05-03 18:49:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2020-05-04 04:42:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-05-04 23:34:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-05-05 15:55:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

lgtm, for safer side it is ok to explicitly ask for py3 venv.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-05-05 19:19:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I have something similar in https://review.opendev.org/724198

That uses the ensure-pip role from zuul-jobs and installs stackviz under python3 using venv, so doesn't require a virtualenv dependency.

One other problem that fixes is that suse 15 still runs ansible under python2 (https://review.opendev.org/#/c/724777).  that tries to "import pkg_resources" so requires python2 setuptools to work, even if it's installing python3.  724198 works around that too.  in some cases something else may have fixed that up for you, but at least on keystone testing, this is the first place that tries to use pip: to install stuff.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2020-05-05 20:02:11.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Ian's patches are a better fix for this"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-03 18:49:26.000000000', 'message': 'Use python3 for stackviz

No matter what interpreter is used to run ansible, ensure that stackviz
is installed in a python3 virtualenv.

Change-Id: I2c21237bc34826eea3033dac1bd83068bf3f97ba
'}]
commit_message:
Use python3 for stackviz

No matter what interpreter is used to run ansible, ensure that stackviz
is installed in a python3 virtualenv.

Change-Id: I2c21237bc34826eea3033dac1bd83068bf3f97ba

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-01 15:45:21.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up unused IRC channels

Remove some unused OpenStack IRC channels from our gerritbot config.
Accessbot configuration is being left in place to provide continuity
in case the channel needs to be resurrected at some future date.
These were all discussed in an openstack-discuss ML thread in March,
and nobody has raised any objection:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-March/013257.html

A follow-up notification about this change is being sent to the ML
as well.

Change-Id: I8e7e945bea87b4e53883e9679ac149a5cdece9b6
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up unused IRC channels

Remove some unused OpenStack IRC channels from our gerritbot config.
Accessbot configuration is being left in place to provide continuity
in case the channel needs to be resurrected at some future date.
These were all discussed in an openstack-discuss ML thread in March,
and nobody has raised any objection:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-March/013257.html

A follow-up notification about this change is being sent to the ML
as well.

Change-Id: I8e7e945bea87b4e53883e9679ac149a5cdece9b6

commit_message:
Update Neutron grafana dashboard

Made the following changes:
 - Added py38 and removed py37
 - Removed some "(non-voting)" from jobs that are now voting
 - Added missing tripleo jobs for Neutron and OVN
 - Added missing ovn-rally-task job

Change-Id: I39fd01c1f4a72cf930064849dc34b92e5901c92a

commit_message:
use more distinct link references in release notes

Linking to release note sections implicitly is bad because there can
be multiple sections on a page with the same name. Insert explicit
anchors for the references from the prelude to various upgrade notes.

Change-Id: I56d05a32131bbf4eade0264ea5569239659fe121
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Include toci roles as a part of quickstart extra requires

In order to consume toci roles with in tripleo-ci deployment jobs,
the toci roles needs to be installed in venv so that ansible can
find those roles.

It is needed for reusing oooci-image-build in TQE image-build.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/721178/

Change-Id: I291e1d6a97b83a4ce540d3d48a4db97af1ca1244
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] initialize osds with zero weights by reading from values

This is to read the decision of initializing osds with zero weights from
values since a few clusters don't need it. Currently OSDs that are
initialized after the rbd-pool job completes (in the case of an incomplete
deployment that is completed later) are perpetually stuck with zero CRUSH
weight.

Also cleaning up some helper functions to remove unnecessary 'echo'
commands.

Change-Id: I4add501eec10fba3463a387bf639aabeff1efb0e

Rename the job following the template change to avoid duplicate

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014602.html

commit_message:
Switch to new grenade job name

The integrated gate template (integrated-gate-py3) has been switched
to the new grenade name (grenade-py3 -> grenade). This repo uses the
template but also has for irrelevant files an extra entry.

Rename the job following the template change to avoid duplicate
grenade runs.

Details:
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014602.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/725148
Change-Id: I73e67c0e01ca231678903b2460dab672f17251e3
(cherry picked from commit c104afec7dd72edfd909847bee9c14eaf077a28b)

commit_message:
Pin dogpile.cache!=0.9.1 version

dogpile.cache package 0.9.1 seam to have a compatibility
issue when using on CentOS 8 systems [1]

0.9.2 is expected to fix the issue as soon it is released

[1] Issue #178 - https://github.com/sqlalchemy/dogpile.cache/issues/178

Change-Id: Iccc9f1346a25ade34f1482081d5c7a4d0deefbf3

commit_message:

commit_message:
Add index page for plugins documents

Now we have more documents for plugins on stable release,
support and their testing policy. Let's prepare a
index page for it will be easy for plugins maintainer.

Also renaming the stable support policy section to have a clear
name.

Adding redirect links for moved documents.

Change-Id: I17a9a6e0e88605a0ee5047678d6ed168c31396ec

commit_message:
Add document for stable branch testing for tempest plugins

As Tempest and plugins master version is used to test the supported
stable branches, we need to test them on master gate.

Adding document for that so that we can test the stable branches
more consistently on plugins side too.

Change-Id: Ied3c6bb4032fd3740ae0d6d185e4a138fd335b02

commit_message:
Add Octavia file in devstack/lib

Looks like this was initially missed on the OVN migration,
but after talking with Octavia, this setup should really
all live here since it's SDN-specific things that are
being configured.

Content basically copied from the octavia devstack/plugin.sh
script with some small modifications to support OVN.

Change-Id: Idb80cd164c6b41ca6636373696a9a1e7f19b5e62
(cherry picked from commit 0493af3399391ed6003560dbcd46adce0edadfb9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-24 15:33:55.000000000', 'message': 'Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I35b2404890339a4e1f18adf49a2de58d45bb1523
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: I35b2404890339a4e1f18adf49a2de58d45bb1523
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-03-30 11:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2020-03-30 13:56:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It looks good to propose it directly to stable/train as we plan to bump the min version of xstatic-mdi in the master branch https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715925/.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-05-05 18:15:50.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

commit 74d76e900f28e88190a35bff921c56349077ca53 fixed the issue, so this workaround is no longer needed.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-30 11:56:45.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Workaround for xstatic-mdi 1.4.57.0 support with latest pyScss

commit ddc52a7405f0be38629f665d24bcf75022ce0018 made horizon scss
work again with the latest pyScss 1.3.6 or later, but it only support
XStatic-mdi 1.6.50.2 and it does not work with XStatic-mdi 1.4.57.0
(which is the minimum version horizon declares).
It is because $mdi-icons variable is only defined in mdi 1.6.50.2.
This commit checks the existence of $mdi-icons and if not use the logic
to use variables ($hexes and $names) from mdi 1.4.57.0.

Note that this is only for backward compatibility and will be dropped
from the master branch once it is applied to stable branches.

Change-Id: I4f138cd94d788e3c90858b9b403f6c94930a9886
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Workaround for xstatic-mdi 1.4.57.0 support with latest pyScss

commit ddc52a7405f0be38629f665d24bcf75022ce0018 made horizon scss
work again with the latest pyScss 1.3.6 or later, but it only support
XStatic-mdi 1.6.50.2 and it does not work with XStatic-mdi 1.4.57.0
(which is the minimum version horizon declares).
It is because $mdi-icons variable is only defined in mdi 1.6.50.2.
This commit checks the existence of $mdi-icons and if not use the logic
to use variables ($hexes and $names) from mdi 1.4.57.0.

Note that this is only for backward compatibility and will be dropped
from the master branch once it is applied to stable branches.

Change-Id: I4f138cd94d788e3c90858b9b403f6c94930a9886

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-01 12:40:35.000000000', 'message': "[OVN] Do not delete port's revision on RowNotFound

The delete_port() method from OVNClient has a potential problem of
leaving stale ports when RowNotFound is raised from the process to
delete the port from the OVN database. Since the exception is not
granular enough, the RowNotFound could be raised from other objects that
are part of the same transaction (such as ACLs, DNS entries, etc...)
resulting in the revision for the port being deleted even tho the port
is still in the database.

Instead of giving a pass on the RowNotFound exception, this patch is
logging the error and re-raising it without deleting the revision.

(cherry-picked from Neutron I25b93b7c080403fc38365b638e4e03298b447d0f)

Change-Id: Ic0d1234b032a58ce370e1703edc259b584099238
Partial-Bug: #1874733
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[OVN] Do not delete port's revision on RowNotFound

The delete_port() method from OVNClient has a potential problem of
leaving stale ports when RowNotFound is raised from the process to
delete the port from the OVN database. Since the exception is not
granular enough, the RowNotFound could be raised from other objects that
are part of the same transaction (such as ACLs, DNS entries, etc...)
resulting in the revision for the port being deleted even tho the port
is still in the database.

Instead of giving a pass on the RowNotFound exception, this patch is
logging the error and re-raising it without deleting the revision.

(cherry-picked from Neutron I25b93b7c080403fc38365b638e4e03298b447d0f)

Conflicts:
    networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py

Change-Id: Ic0d1234b032a58ce370e1703edc259b584099238
Partial-Bug: #1874733
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add "inactivity_probe" parameter to "enable_connection_uri"

Added "inactivity_probe" parameter (milliseconds) to the set manager
command. The command timeout and the manager inactivity probe are
now two different parameters.

This patch also solves a problem related with the kwargs passed to
the command executor. Both related parameters, "timeout" and
"inactivity_probe" are removed first from this dictionary.

This function is, at the present time, only called once from Neutron.

Change-Id: I7818c5b60eabca08963c623dd131784791b7dc37
Related-Bug: #1868686

Add release file for ussuri release

Added validate-on var for overcloud and ipa images as those does not
exists currently. It will pass the tests.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[OVN] Do not delete port's revision on RowNotFound

The delete_port() method from OVNClient has a potential problem of
leaving stale ports when RowNotFound is raised from the process to
delete the port from the OVN database. Since the exception is not
granular enough, the RowNotFound could be raised from other objects that
are part of the same transaction (such as ACLs, DNS entries, etc...)
resulting in the revision for the port being deleted even tho the port
is still in the database.

Instead of giving a pass on the RowNotFound exception, this patch is
logging the error and re-raising it without deleting the revision.

(cherry-picked from Neutron I25b93b7c080403fc38365b638e4e03298b447d0f)

Conflicts:
       networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py

Change-Id: Ic0d1234b032a58ce370e1703edc259b584099238
Partial-Bug: #1874733
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

In commit I1a75f1bf12747508a3497293650d3cc668202de6 the worker node
is missed to add the docker storage support. And the current systemd
unit is not really working. So this patch fixes it by removing the
hardcode for /dev/vdb and using xfs instead of ext4 (the same way
for Fedora Atomic) to make it simpler and solid.

Story: 2005201

Change-Id: I4c465664eb19f1992df95750dd7b2d99688c6cae

commit_message:
[k8s] Fix docker storage of Fedora CoreOS

In commit I1a75f1bf12747508a3497293650d3cc668202de6 the worker node
is missed to add the docker storage support. And the current systemd
unit is not really working. So this patch fixes it by removing the
hardcode for /dev/vdb and using xfs instead of ext4 (the same way
for Fedora Atomic) to make it simpler and solid.

Task: 39331
Story: 2005201

Change-Id: I4c465664eb19f1992df95750dd7b2d99688c6cae
(cherry picked from commit c2439ca10aed0dbfa25a7e613a8105d93536db87)
